Wagenitz, G., Index coll, princ. herb. Gott. 167. 1982.

Traunsteiner, Joseph (1798-1850), Austrian pharmacist and botanist at Kitzbühl;
studied pharmacy at Brixen and botany and chemistry at the University of Vienna
(1820); in charge of his father's pharmacy at Kitzbühl from 1820-1850 (from 1829 as
owner). (<em>Traunst</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: IBF; further material in BR, BREG, FI, GJO, MW, REG,
WAG.
<em>Exsiccatae</em>: <em>Herbarium vivum</em>, see Flora 16: 230-236. 1833.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 3: 695; Backer p. 591; Barnhart 3: 398 (b. 18 Dec
1798, d. 19 Mar 1850); Biol.-Dokum. 18: 9349; CSP 6: 24; DTS 1: 305-306; Frank 3
(Anh.): 105; Hegi 2: 352; IH 1 (ed. 7): 344; PR 9453, ed. 1: 10424; Rehder 2: 102; TR
47: 28-30; Tucker 1: 697.

14.892. <em>Monographie der Weiden von Tirol und</em> Vorarlberg ... Innsbruck (gedruckt mit
Wagner'schen Schriften) 1842. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1842 (Regensburg rd. 13-20 Feb 1843), p. [1]-40. <em>Copy</em>: B-S. – Reprinted and to
	be cited from Neue Z. Ferdinandeum Tirol Vorarlberg 8: [68]-105. 1842.
<em>Ref</em>.: Anon. [Schlechtendal, D.F.L. von], Bot. Zeit. 1: 203. 24 Mar 1843 (rev.).

Trautvetter, Ernst Rudolf von (1809-1889), Courland-born Baltic-Russian botanist;
studied medicine 1825-1829 and natural sciences 1829-1831 at Dorpat Univ., botanized
in Livonia 1829-1830; private teacher at Mitau 1831-1833; Cand. phil. Dorpat 1833;
assistant Bot. Gard. ib. 1833-1835; habil. ib. 1833, lecturer 1834-1835; Dr. phil. Univ.
Königsberg 1835; assistant at Bot. Gard. St. Petersburg 1835-1838; professor of botany
and director of the Bot. Gard. Kiew 1838-1859 (1847-1859 rector of the university);
director of the Agricultural Institute at Gory-Gorki [Gorigoretzki] (Mogilev) 1860-
1864, administrator (1865-1867) and director of the botanical garden in St. Petersburg
1867-1875; from 1875-1889 in retirement in St. Petersburg. (<em>Trautv</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LE; further material in BR, C, CORD, H, KW, MW. – <em>Letters</em> to
D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 591-592; Barnhart 3: 398 (b. 8 Feb 1809, d. 27
Jan 1889); Biol.-Dokum. 18: 9353; BJI 1: 58; BM 5: 2134; Bossert p. 405; Bret. p. 1064;
CSP 6: 24-25, 8: 1109, 19: 191; Herder p. 481 [index]; Hortus 3: 1205; Jackson p. 5, 119,
121, 326, 327, 328, 357, 393, 442, 483, 507; Langman p. 744; Lasègue p. 341; LS 27070;
Morren ed. 2, p. 30, ed. 10, p. 95; MW p. 501-502; NI 1184, 1993; PR 6209, 9456-9467,
ed. 1: 10430-10437; Rehder 5: 857; SO 852; TL-1/1326; TL-2/1785, 5978, see F.G.M.
Herder, C.A. von Meyer; Tucker 1: 14, 697, 2: xxxviii; Zander ed. 10, p. 725, ed. 11, p.
827.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Friedrich Wilhelm Trautvetter (b. 21 Apr 1782, d. 1860) and Ernst Rudolph von
Trautvetter (1809-1889) were sons of J.E.C. Trautvetter. Friedrich Wilhelm T. pub-
lished <em>Der Schilfroggen</em> (Secale arundinaceum), Dresden &amp; Leipzig 1840. 31 p. (n.v.). –
Johann Ernst Christian von Trautvetter (1780-1889) was a German (Saxonian) philo-
sopher, teacher and author who settled in Courland (Mitau) in 1804; father of E.R.
Trautvetter. He published <em>De novo systemate botanico brevem notitiam</em>, Mitau 1842 (also in
Bot. Soc. Natural. Moscou 14(3): [509]-528. 1841), German version in Linnaea 16(6):
561-582, <em>1 pl</em>. Mar 1843.

HEADING: TRAUTVETTER

Traverso, Giovanni Battista (1878-1955), Italian mycologist and phytopathologist;
Dr. phil. Pavia 1900; assistant at the Botanical Institute of Padua; habil. Padua 1905;
asst. director Phytopathological Station Roma 1915; professor of phytopathology at the
R. Ist. superiore agrario di Milano 1925. (<em>Traverso</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: PAD and PAV; other material at MIPV, MOD, ROPV. –
<em>Exsiccatae</em>: <em>Fungi italici exsiccati</em> (seu Mycothecae Italicae series altera) fasc. 1, nos. 1-50.
1913 (1914?). – <em>Letters</em> to W.G. Farlow at FH.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Not to be confused with the Italian mineralogist and mining-engineer Giovanni
Battista Traverso (b. 26 Sep 1843, d. 1 Jun 1914), see Poggendorff 6: 2685. 1940.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 12(2): 671; Barnhart 3: 399 (b. 25 Oct 1878); BL 2:

employed by a firm of patent agents until 1937. (<em>Travis</em>).

Treboux, Octave (1876-?), Estonian botanist (mycologist, algologist), born at Pernau
[Pärna]; Dr. phil. Leipzig 1903, student of Pfeffer; plant physiologist at the Universities
of Charkow and Riga. (<em>Treboux</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

1901 (last proof read 22 Jan 1901).

Trécul, Auguste [Adolphe Lucien] (1818-1896), French botanist; studied pharmacy
at Paris (Maître de pharmacie 1845) but dedicating himself to botany; travelled in
North America 1848-1850; from 1850 working at the Muséum d'Histoire naturelle,
Paris without official status. (<em>Trécul</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: P. – <em>Manuscript</em> catalogue at P (Phanérogamie), for other manu-
script material see Jovet et Willmann (1957) p. 102. – <em>Letters</em> at G, NY, PH.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 662; Barnhart 3: 399 (b. 8 Jan 1818, d. 15 Oct
1896); BM 5: 2135; CSP 6: 27-29, 8: 1110-1112, 11: 636-638 (bibl. 154 nos.); Ewan ed.
1: 324, ed. 2: 223; Frank 3 (Anh.): 105; Hortus 3: 1205; Lenley p. 471 (letter to Torrey);
LS 27071-27089; Morren ed. 10, p. 55; MW p. 502; PH 364; PR 9468, ed. 1: 10442;
Rehder 5: 858; Tucker 1: 698; Zander ed. 10, p. 725, ed. 11, p. 827.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bonplandia 1: 34 (on Acad. sci.), 65 (rev. work on tree growth) 1853;
	Bot. Gaz. 22: 432. 1896 (d.); Bot. Not. 1897: 47 (d.); Bot. Zeit. 54: 352. 1896 (d.);
	Bull. Soc. bot. France 43 (bibl.): 431-432. 1896 (obit.); Cat. gén. livr. impr. Bibl. natl.
	193: 626-628. 1966; Flora 49: 221. 1866 (elected member Acad. Sci. succeeding
	Montagne); Grand Larousse encycl. 10: 470. 1964; Illustr. hort. ser. 6. 3(1): 355-356.
	1896 (d.); Index biogr. Acad. Sci. Paris 495. 1954; Nat. Nov. 18: 506. 1896 (d.);
	Nature 55: 11, 108. 1896 (obit. not.); Österr. bot. Z. 46: 473. 1896 (d.); Rev. hort.
	belge étrang. 22: 264. 1896 (obit. not.); Science ser. 2. 4: 721. 1896 (d.); Table art.
	orig., Bull. Soc. bot. France 226-227.

<em>Abstract</em>: CR. Acad. Sci., Paris 35: 654-657. 1852 (read 2 Nov 1852).

Treffer, Georg (1847-1902), Austrian botanist, plant collector and mountain guide at
Luttach, Tirol. (<em>Treffer</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (large coll. in herb. Ullepitsch); further material in A, AK,
AUT, E, GB, GOET, MANCH, TUR. – Sent out annual Catalogues of dried plants
(mainly from Tirol) from 1880-1902 (nos. 1-22) which could be bought per century or
per specimen. Apart from the plants from Tirol, Treffer offered in these catalogues
material from other parts of Europe and from the Orient sometimes collected by others.
– <em>Letters</em> to K. Keck in UPS-UB.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 6(1): 800, 12(2): 127; Barnhart 3: 399 (b. 11 Apr
1847, d. 31 Oct 1902); Bossert p. 406; DTS 1: 407, 6(4): 61; Hegi 6(2): 1257; IH 2:
(files); Morren ed. 10, p. 37.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Not. 1903: 34 (d.); Österr. bot. Z. 52: 507. 1902 (d.).
Lack, H.W. &amp; D. Wagner, Willdenowia 14: 432, 433. 1984 (large coll. in herb.
	Ullepitsch).
Lack, H.W. &amp; C.-O. von Sydow, Willdenowia 14: 442. 1982 (letters to K. Keck in UPS-
UB).
Sarntheim, L. Graf von, Österr. bot. Z. 53: 336-340. 1903 (obit., descr. coll.).

Treffner, Eduard (fl. 1881), Baltic-German pharmacist; Mag. pharm. Dorpat 1881.
(<em>Treffner</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Herder p. 124.

14.970. <em>Beiträge zur Chemie der Laubmoose</em>. Inaugural-Dissertation zur Erlangung des
Grades eines Magisters der Pharmacie verfasst und mit Genehmigung einer Hochver-
ordneten Medicinischen Facultät der Kaiserlichen Universität zu Dorpat zur öffentli-
chen Vertheidigung bestimmt von Eduard Treffner ... Dorpat (Druck von
Schnakenburg's litho- und typographischer Anstalt) 1881. Oct. (<em>Beitr. Chemie Laubm</em>.).

<em>Publ</em>.: Feb-Mar 1881 (imprimatur 12 Feb 1881; Bot. Centralbl. 4-8 Apr 1881; Bot. Zeit.
	27 Mai 1881; Nat. Nov. Apr(1) 1881), p. [1]-62, [63, theses]. <em>Copies</em>: B, H.
<em>Ref</em>.: Kienitz-Gerloff, J.H.E.F., Bot. Zeit. 41: 315-318. 1883 (rev.).

Treichel, Alexander [Johann August] (1837-1901), German (Prussian) landed pro-
prietor and botanist; studied law and economics at Berlin University from 1859; as-
sociated with P. Ascherson, A. Braun, L. Kny and other Berlin botanists; secretary of the
Botanische Verein der Provinz Brandenburg 1870-1876; in charge of the family estate
Hoch-Paleschken nr. Alt-Kischau, Westpreussen from 1876. (<em>Treichel</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some material at KIEL (fungi).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 399 (d. 24 Aug 1901); Biol.-Dokum. 18:
9358-9359; CSP 19: 194; De Toni 1: cxxiv; GR p. 145; LS 27090-27097, 40034-40035;
Morren ed. 10, p. 13; Rehder 5: 859; Tucker 3: 311.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Abromeit, J., Jahresber. Preuss. bot. Ver. 1901-1902: 9-14. 1902 (biogr., bibl.).
Anon., Verh. bot. Ver. Brandenburg 43: lxxiv. 1902 (d. 24 Aug 1901).
Caspary, R., Festschr. 50j. Bestehen Preuss. bot. Ver. 281-282. 1915 (curr. vit., portr.,
	bibl., b. 28 Aug 1837, d. 4 Aug 1901).
Lakowitsz, C., Jahresber. West-Preuss. bot.-zool. Ver. 50: 21-22. 1928 (biogr. sketch,
	portr.).

<sm>COMPOSITE</sm> <sm>WORKS</sm>: Editor, Verh. bot. Ver. Brandenburg 12-18, 1870-1876.

PAGE: 458
HEADING: TREICHEL

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Treichelia</em> Vatke (1874).

14.971. <em>Fleischpilze aus dem Kreise Bereut</em> ... Sonder-Abdruck aus dem Bericht über die
zwanzigste Wander-Versammlung des Westpreussischen botanisch-zoologischen
Vereins, zu Kreuz a.d. Ostbahn ... 1898. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1898, p. [1]-27. <em>Copy</em>: B. – Reprinted and to be cited from Schr. naturf. Ges.
	Danzig ser. 2. 9(3): 107-133. 1898.
<em>Nachtrag</em>: ib. 10(1): 64. 1899.

Trelease William (1857-1945), American botanist; B.S. Cornell Univ. 1880; studied
at Harvard Univ. with e.g. A. Gray ad W.G. Farlow 1880-1881; instructor in botany,
Univ. Wisconsin 1881-1883, professor of botany and head of the Botany Dept. ib. 1883-
1885; Dr. Sci. Harvard 1884; with the Shaw School of Botany and the Missouri Botan-
ical Garden from 1885-1912; director of the Garden 1889-1912; professor of botany and
head of the Department of Botany, Univ. Illinois 1913-1926; professor emeritus ib. 1926-
1945. (<em>Trel</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: MO and ILL. – Other material at A, AK, C, CUP, DPU, GH,
K, NY, PAD, PC (Madeira mosses), PRE. – <em>Letters</em> e.g. at FH, G, GH, NY, PC, PH,
UPS-UB, US. – Personal library at DPU.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Bakker p. 662; Barnhart 3: 399 (b. 22 Feb 1857, d. 1 Jan
1945); Biol.-Dokum. 18: 9359; BJI 1: 58, 2: 179; BL 1: 87, 127, 321; BM 1: 522, 557, 5:
2135-2136, 8: 1324; Bossert p. 406; CSP 11: 638, 12: 739-740, 19: 196; De Toni 1: cxxiv;
DSB 13: 456 (J. Ewan); Ewan ed. 1: 197, 270, 324-325, ed. 2: 223-224; GR p. 250;
Hirsch p. 303; Hortus 3: 1205; IH 1 (ed. 6): 365, (ed. 7): 344; Kelly p. 259; Langman p.
744-746; Lenley p. 414; LS 8356, 23444, 24562, 27099-27119, 40036, suppl. 2858,
28066, 28069; Moebius p. 361; Morren ed. 10, p. 132; MW p. 502; NI alph.; Nordstedt
suppl. p. 16; NW p. 59; PH p. 539 [index]; Rehder 5: 859; SIA see index; SO 2868,
3671; Stevenson p. 1260; TL-2/1696, 2132, 3095, 3339, 4392, 4421, 10.291, 12.543-
12.545; Tucker 1: 14, 698-699, 2: xxxviii, 3: 312; Urban-Berl. 283, 404; Zander ed. 10,
p. 725, ed. 11, p. 827.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Allg. bot. Z. 19: 96. 1913 (app. Urbana, 111.); Amer. men Sci. eds. 1-7,
	1906-1944; Bot. Centralbl. 77: 143. 1899 (memb. h.c. Soc. Sci. Mex.), 110: 607-608.

15.005. <em>Code of botanical nomenclature</em>. Code de la nomenclature botanique. Codex der
botanischen Nomenklatur. New York 1904. Oct. (<em>Code bot. nom</em>.).

<em>Authorship</em>: Proposal, by a nomenclature commission of the Botanical Club of the
	American Association for the Advancement of Science submitted to the International
	Botanical Congress, Wien 1905. "We ... recommend, ..., that, in accordance with
	the provisions of the committee on organization of the Congress of 1905, the Code of
	laws of 1867 be amended by the abandonment of all its articles and the substitution of
	the appended Code". Members and alternates: J.C. Arthur, John Hendley Barnhart,
	N.L. Britton, Stewardson Brown, Frederick E. Clements, O.F. Cook, John M.
	Coulter, Frederick V. Coville, F.S. Earle, Aleander W. Evans, Tracy E. Hazen,
	Arthur Hollick, Marshall A. Howe, F.H. Knowlton, George T. Moore, E.L. Morris,
	William Alphonso Murrill, H.H. Rusby, C.L. Shear, William Trelease, Lucien M.
	Underwood, David White, William F. Wight.

	bot. Club 31: 249-261. 1904.

Tremols y Borrell, Federico (1831-1900), Spanish (Catalonian) botanist and phar-
maceutical chemist; professor of inorganic chemistry at Granada, later prof. of the his-
tory of pharmacy at Barcelona. (<em>Tremols</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BC (ca. 8000); further material in AWH, B (mainly destr.), BR,
F, GOET, MAF, MW, W. – <em>Letters</em> at G, UPS-UB.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 399 (b. Mai 1831, d. 21 Jan 1900); BL 2:
501, 724; Bossert p. 406; CSP 19: 197; Herder p. 133; Morren ed. 10, p. 51; Urban-Berl.
p. 404.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bull. Acad. Géogr. bot. 9: 13, 57. 1900 (d.); Bull. Soc. bot. France 47:
	49. 1900 (d.); Encicl. univ. ilustr. eur.-amer. 64: 71-72. 1928.
Lack, H.W. &amp; C.-O. von Sydow, Willdenowia 14: 442. 1984 (letters UPS-UB).
Wagenitz, G., Index coll. princ. herb. Gott. 167. 1982.

Trentepohl, Johann Friedrich (1748-1806), German (Oldenburg) clergyman and
botanist; studied theology at Leipzig; private teacher at Dötlingen and Rodenkirchen;
pastor at Eckwarden 1781-1789, from 1789-1806 at Oldenbrok. (<em>Trentep</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Owned a moss herbarium which came to the museum in
Oldenburg (coll. Oldenburg no longer extant) (cf. F. Koppe, 1964).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (1) The entomologist Johann Jacob Trentepohl (<em>fl</em>. 1800-1830) collected plants in
China and Guinea (specimens at C). Karl Trentepohl listed by LS and Stevenson is an
error for J.F. Trentepohl.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (2) Trentepohl left a mss. <em>Flora von Oldenburg</em> (at Oldenburg Museum); it was
published by Karl Hagena q.v. TL-2/2260 (additional <em>copies</em> seen by us: B-S, HH; see
also note by D.F.L. von Schlechtendal, Linnaea 13 (Litt.): 168-169. 1840. The preface
to the <em>Flora</em> contains biographical data on Trentepohl.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 592; Barnhart 3: 400 (b. 17 Feb 1748, d. 16
Mar 1806); BM 5: 2136, 8: 1324; De Toni 1: cxxiv; Frank 3 (Anh.): 105; Herder p. 189;
LS 27122 (err. "Karl"), 27117; PR 9469, ed. 1: 10444; Rehder 1: 380; Stevenson p.
1260 (err. "Karl"); TL-2/2260-2261.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Koppe, F., Abh. Naturw. Ver. Bremen 36: 239, 257. 1964 (Moosherbar in Mus.
	Oldenburg).
Focke, W.O., Abh. Naturw. Ver. Bremen 14(2): 277. 1897.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Trentepohlia</em> A.W. Roth (1800, <em>nom. rej</em>.); <em>Trentepohlia</em> C.F.P. Martius (1817,

PAGE: 469
HEADING: TREUB

<em>nom. cons</em>.); <em>Trentepohlia</em> W.H. Harvey (1833); <em>Trentepohlia</em> Boeckeler (1858); <em>Trentepohlia</em>
N. Pringsheim (1862).

Treub, Melchior (1851-1910), Dutch botanist of Swiss descent; studied at Leiden
1869-1873; Dr. phil. ib. 1873; assistant at the Leiden botanical institute with W.F.R.
Suringar 1873-1880; director of the Buitenzorg [Bogor] botanical gardens 1880-1909;
director of agriculture Netherlands Indies 1905-1909. (<em>Treub</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some further material at E, GE (destr.), K, MEL. – Algal coll.
lost (Koster 1969). – <em>Letters</em> to W.G. Farlow at FH; other letters at G, PH, UPS-UB.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 592 (b. 26 Dec 1851, d. 3 Oct 1910); Biol-
Dokum. 18: 9366; BJI 1: 58; BM 5: 2136-2137; Clokie p. 406; CSP 8: 1113, 11: 640, 12:
740, 19: 199; De Toni 1: cxxiv; DSB 13: 458-460 (C.G.G. van Steenis); Frank 3 (Anh.):
105-106; GR p. 709; Herder p. 164, 260, 273, 274, 309, 320, 366; Jackson p. 2, 74, 82,
93, 149, 160; JW 1: 449, 2: 202, 3: 372-373, 4: 411, 5: 254; Kelly p. 229; LS 27125-
27128, 40036a, 41788-41791; Moebius p. 195, 196, 214, 333, 348, 367, 421; Morren ed.
10, p. 90, 146; PH 444; Rehder 5: 859; SK 1: 531-532, 4: lxx-clxi, 8: xcviii; TL-2/see
H.M.C.L.F. zu Solms-Laubach; Tucker 1: 699.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Editor, <em>Annales du Jardin botanique de Buitenzorg</em>, vols. 2-23, 1881-
1910.
(2) Editor, <em>Icones bogorienses 1-3</em>. 1897-1909.

<sm>FESTSCHRIFT</sm>: Ann. Jard. bot. Buitenzorg suppl. 2, 1898. "Hommage à M. le Dr.
Melchior Treub ..." 167 p.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: One of Treub's most important creations was the Visitor's Laboratory at the
Buitenzorg Botanical Garden, set up to enable visiting botanists to do extended scientific
work in the tropics. This laboratory saw nearly 200 visitors in its most important period:
1885-1939. On 1 January 1885 Treub sent a printed letter [4 p., copy at G] to botanists
and botanical institutions abroad giving information of this opportunity for tropical
research. In 1914 the renovated laboratory was named "Treub Laboratory".

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Melchiora</em> Penzig et P.A. Saccardo (1897); <em>Treubania</em> Van Tieghem (1897);
<em>Treubella</em> Van Tieghem (1894); <em>Treubia</em> Goebel (1891, <em>nom. cons</em>.); <em>Treubiomyces</em> F. von
Höhnel (1909) and the derived genera <em>Apotreubia</em> Hattori et Mizutani (1967) and <em>Tre-
ubiites</em> R.M. Schuster (1966). <em>Treubella</em> Pierre (1890) may also be named for Treub, but
no etymology was given. – Journal: <em>Treubia</em>, Buitenzorg (Bogor) 1919-x. – <em>Laboratory</em>:
Treub Laboratorium, Buitenzorg (Bogor).

15.052. <em>Onderzoekingen over de natuur der lichenen</em>. Academisch proefschrift, ter verkrijging
van den graad van Doctor in de Wis- en Natuurkunde, aan de Hoogeschool te Leiden,
... op Zaterdag den 22sten November 1873, des namiddags te 3 uren, in het openbaar te
verdedigen door Melchior Treub, geboren te Voorschoten. Leiden (Gebroeders van der
Hoek) 1873. Oct. (<em>Onderz. nat. lich</em>.).

Treuinfels, Leo M. (1848-?), Austrian clergyman (O.S.B.) and botanist; sometime
professor of natural history at the Benedictine Gymnasium Marienberg (Meran), later
abbot of the Stift Marienberg, Vinschgau. (<em>Treuinf</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: IBF; some material in E. – <em>Letters</em> in G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 400 (b. 4 Jun 1848); BM 5: 2137; CSP 11:

Treumann, Karl (<em>fl</em>. 1880), Baltic-German botanist; Mag. pharm. Dorpat 1880, later
at St. Petersburg. (<em>Treumann</em>).

Trevelyan, [Sir] Walter Calverley, 6th Baronet (1797-1879), British botanist, geolo-
gist and antiquarian; M.A. Univ. Coll. Oxford 1822; landlord, agriculturist and private
scientist; travelled frequently in southern Europe. (<em>Trevelyan</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: HAMU; further material at AK, C, CGE, E, E-GL, EBH, K,
OXF, SWN, WAR, YRK. – <em>Letters</em> at K, LINN.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 400; BB p. 304-305; BM 5: 2137, 8: 1324;
Clokie p. 256; CSP 6: 34, 8: 1114; Desmond p. 618 (b. 31 Mar 1797, d. 23 Mar 1879);
DNB 19: 1137 (57: 210); GR p. 417; IH 2: (files); LS 27129-27132; PR 9470, ed. 1:
10453; Quenstedt p. 435; Rehder 1: 252, 5: 859.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Archaeologia aeliana ser. 3. 10: 154-156. 1913 (curr. vit., list publ.); Bot.
	Not. 1880: 28 (d.); Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 241: 281. 1964; Bull. Soc. bot.

PAGE: 475
HEADING: TREVIRANUS

15.079. <em>On the vegetation and temperature of the Faroe Islands</em> ... Florence June 1837. Oct. (<em>Veg. temp. Faroe Isl</em>.).

<em>Publ</em>.: Jun 1837, p. [1]-16. <em>Copies</em>: G(2), HH, – "From the Edinburgh New Phil. Journ.
	for January 1835 [18: 154-164. 1835] reprinted with corrections." Actually an inde-
	pendent publication.

Treviranus, Gottfried Reinhold (1776-1837), German (Bremen) biologist, brother of
Ludolph Christian Treviranus; studied medicine at Göttingen 1793-1796; Dr. med. ib.
1796; professor of mathematics and medicine at the Bremen Lyceum ("gymnasium ill-
ustre") and practicing physician in Bremen 1797-1837; introduced the notion of biology
as the science of life in Germany (1802) almost simultaneously with Lamarck in France.
(<em>G. Trevir</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. Archival material and library in Staatsbibliothek
Bremen.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 38: 588. 1894; Barnhart 3: 400 (b. 4 Feb 1776, d.
16 Feb 1837); BM 5: 2137; CSP 6: 34-35; De Toni 1: cxxiv; DSB 13: 460-462 (P. Smit)
(bibl.); Herder p. 33; Jackson p. 37.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 241: 301-302. 1964; Cat. gén. livr.
	impr. Bibl. natl. 194: 62. 1966.
Barkhausen, G., <em>in</em> Biogr. Skizz. Brem. Aerzte Naturf. 432-590. 1844.
Baron, W., Technik Geschichte 33(4): 307-328. 1966 (study on the notion "biology"
	with Burdach, Treviranus and Lamarck).
Bridson, G.D.R. et al., Nat. hist. mss. res. Brit. Isl. 278.42. 1980.
Focke, W.O., Abh. naturw. Ver. Bremen 6: 11-48. 1879 (biogr.; further biogr. refs. on p.
	34).
Förster, K., EHK, Acta med. empir. 6: 401-402. 1985.
Hirsch, A. et al., eds., Biogr. Lex. hervorrag. Ärzte ed. 2. 5: 633. 1934.
Knittermeyer, H., Gottfried Reinhold Treviranus, Bremen 1937, 23 p., Bremer Beitr.
	Naturw. 4(1): 1-23. 1937.
Martius, C.F.P. von, Akad. Denkreden 55-70. 1866 (biogr., evaluation).
Mon., G., Encicl. ital. 34: 281-282. 1937.
Mourgue, R., J. compar. Neurol. 56: 503-510. 1932 (on his concept of biology).
Nissen, C., Zool. Buchill. 411. 1969.
O., Dict. Sci. méd., Biogr. méd. 7: 360-361. 1825.
Poggendorff, J.C., Biogr.-lit. Handw.-Buch 2: 1132-1133. 1863, 3: 697-698. 1898
	(extensive secondary refs., not repeated here).
Schmid, G., Nova Acta Leop. ser. 2. 2(3-4)(8): 597-620. 1935 (term "biology" coined
	by Karl Friedrich Burdach 1800 in a medical-anthropological context).
Schunke, I., Sudhoff's Arch. Gesch. Med. 30: 115-132. 1965 ("Nachlass" Staatsbibl.
	Bremen).

<sm>COMPOSITE</sm> <sm>WORKS</sm>: Editor, <em>Zeitschrift für Physiologie</em> 1-5, 1824-1835.

15.080. <em>Biologie</em>, oder Philosopie der lebenden Natur für Naturforscher und Aerzte ...
Göttingen (bey Johann Friedrich Röwer) 1802-1822, 6 vols. Oct. (<em>Biologie</em>).

<em>1</em>: 1802, p. [i]-xiv, [1]-477, [478]. – <em>Classen der Pflanzen</em> on p. 433-445.
<em>2</em>: 1803, p. [i]-iv, [1]-508. – Treats e.g. plant geography.
<em>3</em>: 1805, p. [i]-iv, [1]-593, [594, err.].
<em>4</em>: 1814, p. [i]-x, [1]-662.
<em>5</em>: 1818, p. [i]-v, [1]-476, <em>pl. 1-4.</em>
<em>6</em>: 1822, p. [i]-vi, [1]-579, [580], 4 charts.
<em>Copies</em>: B (vol. 1), U-UB (1-6).

Treviranus, Ludolph Christian (1779-1864), German(Bremen) botanist; studied
medicine and natural sciences at Jena; Dr. med. ib. 1801; practicing physician at
Bremen but dedicating himself mainly to botany 1801-1807; third professor of medicine
at the Bremen Lyceum (Gymnasium illustre) 1807-1812; ordinary professor of natural

PAGE: 476
HEADING: TREVIRANUS

history and practicing physician in Rostock 1812-1816; professor of natural history at
Breslau 1816-1830; professor of botany Bonn from 1830. (<em>Trevir</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BHU; mycological material also at B (extant), further material
(ex herb.) in AWH, BREM, H (200), JE, K, L, M, MOD, OXF, PH, WRSL. –
<em>Manuscripts and letters</em>: Staatsbibliothek Bremen (along with those of his two brothers;
many letters to G.R. Treviranus; travelogues, a mss. Flora bremensis (see Buchenau
1890)). – <em>Other letters</em>: G, GH, HAL (to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal), Sondershausen (to
Th. Irmisch, see Müllerott 1980), U (to F.A.W. Miquel), UPS-UB (Brandes et al.).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 38: 588-591 (E. Wunschmann); AG 6(1): 461;
Backer p. 592; Barnhart 3: 400 (b. 18 Sep 1779, d. 6 Mai 1864); Biol.-Dokum. 18: 9367;
Bossert p. 406; Clokie p. 256; CSP 6: 35-38, 8: 1114 (89 nos.); De Toni 1: cxxiv; DSB 13:
462-463 (P. Smit); DTS 1: 306; Frank 3 (Anh.): 106; GR p. 50-51; Herder p. 481
[index]; Hortus 3: 1201; IF p. 734; IH 2: (files); Jackson p. 93, 108, 134, 327, 405;
Lasègue p. 524; LS 27134-27139; Moebius p. 457 [index]; MW p. 502; NI see index; PH

Trevisan de Saint-Léon, Vittore [Benedetto Antonio], Conte (1818-1897), Italian
botanist (cryptogamist). (<em>Trevis</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: GE (fide Saccardo 2: 109; destroyed in World War II); fungi also
at PAD, bryophytes also at PAV. – Trevisan's cryptogamic herbarium was offered for
sale in 1897 (Bot. Centralbl. 71: 336. 1897; Allg. Bot. Z. 3: 184. 1897) with the state-
ment that it contained circa 22.000 species in over 1.000.000 [sic] specimens. We do not
know whether the entire herbarium reached GE. A catalogue of the herbarium was
published by T. in 1851. <em>Lichenotheca veneta</em>, Licheni raccolti nelle Provincie Venete e
publicato in esemplari disecati, ser. 1, fasc. 1-10, nos. 1-33. Barrano 1869; fasc. 1-2 (nos.
1-78) Apr 1869, 3-4 (79-146) Jun 1869, 5-6 (147-207) Aug 1869, 7-8 (208-268) Oct
1869, 9-10 (269-366) s.d. (see Sayre 1969) [fasc. 9-10 "di prossima pubblicazione" Jun
1874, Scritti bot.]. <em>Sets</em>: FH, H, K, L, M, UPS, Venetia (Museo Civico Storia nat.), W.
	– See Sayre (1969). – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL; other letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 662; Barnhart 3: 400 (b. 5 Jun 1818, d. 8 Apr
1897); Biol.-Dokum. 18: 9367; BL 2: 412, 725; BM 1: 448, 5: 2137-2138; Bossert p. 406;
CSP 6: 38-39, 8: 1114, 11: 641-642, 12: 740, 19: 200; De Toni 1: cxxiv-cxxv, 4: lvi; Frank
3 (Anh.): 106; GR p. 524; Hawksworth p. 186; Herder p. 254, 260, 320, 434; Hortus 3:
1205; IF p. 734; Jackson p. 154; Kelly p. 229; Krempelh. 2: 330; LS 27140-27173;
Morren ed. 10, p. 85; NI 3: 53; PR 9487-9493, ed. 1: 10469-10470; Rehder 1: 427; RS p.
145; Saccardo 1: 166, 2: 109; SBC p. 133; Stevenson p. 1260; Tucker 1: 571, 700; Zander
ed. 10, p. 725, ed. 11, p. 827.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Allg. bot. Z. 3: 136. 1897 (d.); Atti Accad. fis.-med. Ital. Milano ser. 4.
	1: 174. 1883 (obit. not.); Bonplandia 6: 54. 1858 (cognomen Leopoldina: Pluche);
	Bot. Centralbl. 70: 336. 1897 (d.; leaves a rich herbarium), 71: 336. 1897 (herb. for
sale); Hedwigia 36: (101). 1897 (d.); Nat. Nov. 19: 331. 1897 (d.); Nature ser. 2. 6:
	96. 1897 (d.); Österr. bot. Z. 47: 311. 1897 (d.).
Candolle, Alph. de, Phytographie 455. 1880.
De Toni, G.B., Nuova Notarisia 8: 89. 1897 (obit. not.); Rendic. Ist. Lombardo Sci. ser.
	2. 30: 1317-1345. 1897 (obit., bibl.).

Trew, Christoph Jakob (1695-1769), German (Bavarian) botanist and physician; Dr.
med. Altorf 1717 (1716?); travelled in Switzerland, France, Holland and Prussia 1717-
1720; practicing physician in Nürnberg 1720-1769; personal physician to the Markgraf
of Ansbach 1736. (<em>Trew</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Trew left his immense library, his manuscripts, correspondence,
engravings, herbaria, flower-books and other material from his national history cabinet
to the Altorfer Universität. This University was combined with that of Erlangen in
1809. Erlangen University obtained the permanent custody of these collections in 1818
(Werner &amp; Schmidt 1937).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 38: 593-594; AG 3: 386, 6(2): 22; Barnhart 3: 400
(b. 26 Apr 1695, d. 18 Jul 1769); Blunt p. 303 [index]; BM 5: 2138; Bossert p. 406;
Dryander 3: [see index]; DU 309-311; GF p. 78; Henrey 2: 63, 235; Herder p. 481;
Hortus 3: 1205; HU 2(1): ccxliv [index], no. 539; Jackson p. 1, 110, 111, 112; Moebius
p. 30, 141; MW p. 502-503; NI 1994-1998; Plesch p. 440; PR 812, 9494-9501, ed. 1: 920,
10445-10452; Rehder 5: 860; RS p. 145; SO 2568b; Sotheby 771; TL-1/96, 1369, 1327-
1331, 1369, see G.D. Ehret; TL-2/541, 10.294, see G.D. Ehret, J.E.J. Schrader; Zander
ed. 10, p. 725, ed. 11, p. 827.

<sm>COMPOSITE</sm> <sm>WORKS</sm>: (1) <em>Bericht von der Anatomie der Pflanzen ... in</em> J.M. Seligmann, Die
Nahrungs-Gefäse [sic]. 1748, TL-2/11.650.
(2) The <em>Herbarium Blackwellianum</em>, 1747-1773, must for the greater part be attributed to
C.J. Trew, see our treatment under TL-2/546.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Neotrewia</em> Pax et K. Hoffmann (1914); <em>Pseudotrewia</em> Miquel (1859); <em>Trevia</em>
Linnaeus (1753); <em>Trewia</em> Linnaeus (1754); <em>Wetria</em> Baillon (1858); <em>Wetriaria</em> (J. Mueller-
Arg.) O. Kuntze (1903).

15.129. D. Christophori Jacobi Trew, ... <em>Beschreibung der grossen americanischen Aloe</em>, theils
aus bewährten autoribus, theils aus eigener Erfahrung zusammen getragen. Wobei das
tägliche Wachsthum des Stengels der in 1726. Jahr zu Nürnberg verblüheten Aloe in
Tabellen mit observationibus meteorologicis erläutert, und die natürliche Beschaffenheit
des reiffen Saamens vorgestellet wird. Nürnberg (Bey Wolfg. Moritz Endters seel.
Erben, und Jul-Arn. Engelbrecht. Gedruckt bey Joh. Ernst Adelbulner) An. 1727.
Oblong. Qu. (<em>Aloe</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1727, frontisp. copp., p. [1]-36. <em>Copy</em>: NY.

15.130. <em>Hortus nitidissimis</em> omnem per annum superbiens floribus sive amoenissimorum
florum imagines quas magnis collegit vir clarissimas D.D. Christophorus Jacobus Trew
... ipso vero annuente in aes incisas vivisque coloribus pictas in publicum edidit
Johannes Michael Seligmann Norimbergae, typis Johannis Josephi Fleischmanni mdccl.
Der das ganze Jahr hindurch im schönsten Flohr stehende Blumen-Garten oder Abbil-
dungen der lieblichsten Blumen, von ... Christoph Jacob Trew, ... mit vielen Kosten
zusammen getragen, auf Desselben Genehmhaltung aber in Kupfer gestochen, und mit
ihren natürlichen Farben vorgestellet herausgegeben von Johann Michael Seligmann ...
Nürnberg (gedruckt bey Johann Joseph Fleischmann) 1750 [-1786]. 3 vols. Fol. (<em>Hort.
nitid</em>.).

<em>Editor</em>: Johann Michael Seligmann (1720-1762), see TL-2/5: 49-499. Principal <em>artist</em>:
	Georg Dionys Ehret (1708-1770). Text (till signature E) by G.L. Huth, G.G. von
	Murr and in part by an anonymous author. The work is usually catalogued under
	Trew's name although Seligmann started the undertaking. Many of the engravings
	were based on the collection of flower drawings owned by Trew.
<em>Publ</em>.: 1750-1786 in parts. <em>Copies</em>: HH, HU, NY, PH (vols. 1-2). The relevant text was
	not published simultaneously. There are 188 plates (nominally, 1-190 with 60-61 and
	121-122 combined on two larger plates) published between 1750 and 1792. Nos. 1-43
	were published by J.M. Seligmann; the others by A.L Wirsing. Plates 1-58 can be
	considered to have formed the first volume; the accompanying text was published in
	1756 and 1768 (probably actually 1767), the plates between 1750 and 1766. Plates
	44-190 are all dated (see Tjaden 1971). The text for plates 60/61-120 came out in
	1772; plate 59 is said to be inserted in vol. 1 even though it came out after the preface
	and index of that volume (dated 1768, publ. prob. 1767) had been printed. The
	plates of "volume" 2 were finished by 1774. The remaining plates came out 1775-
	1792 with text for a third "volume" published in 1786. According to Tjaden the three
	"volumes" are artificial divisions; names should be quoted from letter press or plates.
	– Analysis of HU copy:
	<em>1</em>: 1768 (t.p. date HU copy), all pages unnumbered, 88 p. total, <em>pl. 1-59</em> (59 issued
	with vol. 2?, not in vol. 1 plate index).
	<em>2</em>: 1772 (id.), p. [1]-51. <em>pl. 60-120.</em>
	<em>3</em>: 1786 (id.), p. [i-iv], 1-58, <em>pl. 121-180.</em>
<em>Ref</em>.: Tjaden, W.L., Taxon 20: 461-466. 1971.

15.131. <em>Plantae selectae</em> quarum imagines ad exemplaria naturalia Londini in hortis

PAGE: 485
HEADING: TREW

curiosorum nutrita manu arteficiosa doctaque pinxit Georgius Dionysius Ehret Ger-
manus occasione haud vulgari collegit [et a tab. 1-72] nominibus propriis notisque
subinde illustravit et publico usui dicavit D. Christophorus Jacobus Trew medicus nor-
imbergensis in aes incidit et vivis coloribus repraesentavit Joannes Jacobus Haid pictor
et chalcographus Augustanus ... Decuria i [ii-vii, with this title; viii-x]. [Nürnberg]
1750-1773. Fol. (<em>Pl. select.</em>).

<em>Text</em>: p. [i-iv], [2]-56, [1-2]. – Lectori Benevolo dated pridie Nonas Martii 1750; 7
	engraved handcolored titles, 3 engraved portraits of C.J. Trew, G.D. Ehret, J.J. Haid.
<em>Plates</em>: i-c, handcoloured copp., published in decuriae each with an engraved title [i]; <em>pl.
	1-90</em> unsigned, <em>91-100</em> signed by Haid. For list see HU 539. <em>Artist</em>: Georg Dionys(ius)
	Ehret 1708-1770, TL-2/1: 730-731. <em>Engraver</em>: Johann Jakob Haid (1704-1767).
	<em>Dec. 1</em>: 1750, p. [i], <em>pl. 1-10.</em>
	<em>Dec. 2</em>: 1751, p. [i], <em>pl. 11-20.</em>
	<em>Dec. 3</em>: 1752, p. [i], <em>pl. 21-30.</em>
	<em>Dec. 4</em>: 1754, p. [i], <em>pl. 31-40.</em>
	<em>Dec. 5</em>: 1756, p. [i], <em>pl. 41-50.</em>
	<em>Dec. 6</em>: 1759, p. [i], <em>pl. 51-60.</em>
	<em>Dec. 7</em>: 1765, p. [i], <em>pl. 61-70.</em>
	<em>Dec. 8</em>: 1771 (GGA rev. 11 Jun 1772), p. [i], <em>pl. 71-80.</em> – Title of dec. 8-10: <em>Plantae
	selectae</em> ... germanus collegit et publico usui dicavit D. Christophorus Jacobus Trew
	medicus norimbergensis post ipsius mortem nominibus et notis illustravit D.
	Benedictus Vogel professor medicinae et botanices in Academia altorfina in aes
	incidit et vivis coloribus repraesentavit Johannes Jacobus Haid pictor et chalco-
	graphus Augustanus. Decuria viii [-ix] A.R.S. 1771-1773.
	<em>Dec. 9</em>: 1772 (GGA rev. 3 Jan 1773), p. [i], <em>pl. 81-90.</em>
	<em>Dec. 10</em>: 1773 (GGA rev. 20 Nov 1773), p. [i], <em>pl. 91-100.</em>
<em>Copies</em>: BR, G, HU (for full details see HU 539), NSUB, USDA; IDC 488. – List of
	plants with updated nomenclature in HU 539.

<em>Dutch transl</em>.: <em>by C. Pereboom, Amsterdam 1771-1773, Uitgezochte planten</em>, copies listed by L
	and WAG but not made available to us.

15.132. <em>Librorum botanicorum catalogi duo</em> quorum prior recentiores quosdam posterior pler-
osque antiquos ad annum mdl usque excusos ad ductum propriae collectionis breviter
recenset conscripti a D. Christophoro Jacobo Trew. Norimbergae [Nürnberg] (Stanno
Fleischmanniano) 1752. Fol. (<em>Libr. bot. cat. duo</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1752 (p. ii: Jun 1752), p. [i-ii], [1-54]. <em>Copy</em>: B-S.
<em>Cat. tert</em>.: 1757 (p. ii: vi calend. mart. 1757), p. [i-ii], 55-80. <em>Copy</em>: B-S. – <em>Librorum
	botanicorum catalogus tertiae</em> in quo recentiores quosdam ad ductam propriae collecionis
	porro recenset Christophorus Jacobus Trew. Norimbergae [Nürnberg] (ex typogra-
	phia Christiani de Launoy) 1757. Fol. (<em>Libr. bot. cat. tert</em>.).

15.133. D. Christoph. Jac. Trew <em>Cedrorum libani historia</em> earumque character botanicus
cum ilio Laricis, Abietis Pinique comparatus. Accedit brevis disquisitio an haec arbor sit
ilia ipsa in sacro codice prae omnibus celebrata et vel Aeres vel Berosch dicta itemque
an Graecis botanicis fuerit cognita. Cum tabb. aen. ii. Norimbergae [Nürnberg] (im-
pensis Wolgangi Schwarzkopfii) 1757. Qu. (<em>Cedr. lib. hist</em>.).

[<em>Orig</em>.]: 21 Apr-13 Oct 1757 (preface 21 Apr 1757; GGA 13 Oct 1757; see also Nova
	Acta Leop. 1: 409-437, <em>pl. 8, 9.</em> 1757), p. [i-ii], 1-28, <em>pl</em>. [<em>1-2</em>] (uncol. copp.). <em>Copies</em>: B-
	S, G, HH, NY; IDC 5777.

15.135. <em>Plantae rariores</em> quas maximam partem ipse in horto domestico coluit secundum

	Jacobi).
<em>Decas 3</em>: 1884, n.v.

Triana, José [Jéronimo] (1834-1890), Columbian botanist; after studying medicine
and being active as a journalist connected as botanist, from 1850-1855, with the
Colombian chorographic commission (Comisión Corográfica) exploring the region be-
tween Bogota and the Venezuelan border; working on a Flora colombiana, from 1857 in
France, at first with J.E. Planchon in Montpellier, later in Paris. (<em>Triana</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: The main set containing Triana's types is at COL, but important
sets are also at BM (4.490), G, K, P and W (117). The Bogota herbarium (COL) holds
about two-thirds of Triana's original collection. Further material at B (mainly destr.),
BR, DPU, E, F, FI, H, L, MANCH, MEDEL, MO, NY, US. – General information on
collections and itineraries is given by A. Dugand (1944). A manuscript catalogue of the
Triana holdings at COL is at that herbarium (Kirkbride 1982). – <em>Letters</em> at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 593; Barnhart 3: 400 (b. 22 Mai 1834, d. 31
Oct 1890); BL 1: 249, 321; BM 5: 2138; Bossert p. 406; Colmeiro 1: cciii; CSP 6: 39, 8:
114, 11: 642, 19: 201; DSB 13: 463-464 (E.P. Arbeláez); GF p. 78; Herder p. 481
[index]; Hortus 3: 1205; IH 1 (ed. 6): 365, (ed. 7): 344, 2: (files); Jackson p. 128, 136,
376; Kelly p. 229; Langman p. 746; LS 27175; Morren ed. 10, p. 57; MW p. 502; NI
1999-2000; PR 7171, 9502-9503, 10645, ed. 1: 1332-1333; Rehder 5: 860; RS 145; TL-
2/2148, 6949, 6950, see indexes; Tucker 1: 700; Urban-Berl. p. 272, 315, 414; Zander ed.
10, p. 725, ed. 11, p. 801, 804, 827.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 241: 343-344. 1964; Bull. Soc. bot.
	France 38 (bibl.): 38. 1891 (herb., 8000 specimens, bought by BM); Cat. gén. livr.
	impr. Bibl. natl. 194: 116-118. 1966; Encicl. univ. ilustr. europ.-amer. 64: 226. 1928;
	J. Bot., Morot 4: 456. 1890 (d.); J. Bot. 29: 96. 1891 (herb., 8000, bought by BM);
	Nat. Nov. 12: 490. 1890 (d.); Österr. bot. Z. 41: 40. 1891 (d.).

	obre intitulada "Nouvelles études sur les Quinquinas", escrita por el ilustre botánico
	Colombiano Don J. Triana. Se reproducen, por via de apéndice, las observaciones

HEADING: TRIMEN

	que hizo el célebre doctor Guillermo Jameson [William Jameson, 1796-1873, see TL-

Zürich 1910; industrial chemist as well as lecturer at the Eidg. Technische Hochschule
Zürich. (<em>Trier</em>).

Trimen, Henry (1843-1896), British botanist; M.B. Univ. London 1865, medical off-
icer 1866-1869; assistant Botany Department British Museum 1869-1879; lecturer in
botany at St. Mary's Hospital, London 1867-1872; director of the botanical gardens at
Peradeniya, Ceylon 1879-1896. (<em>Trimen</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: British herbarium at BM; other British material EBH, K, OXF.
Ceylon material BM, CAL, K, PDA, W (e.g. algae). – <em>Letters</em> at FH, G, GH, K, PC.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 597; Barnhart 3: 401 (b. 26 Oct 1843, d. 16
Oct 1896); BB p. 305; BJI 1: 58; BL 1: 6, 2: 224, 244, 256, 321, 725; BM 5: 2139-2140, 8:

HEADING: TRIMEN

325, 435; Hortus 3: 1205; IF p. 734, suppl. 4: 346; IH 1 (ed. 6): 365, (ed. 7): 344, 2:

Trimen, Roland (1840-1916), British entomologist; brother of Henry Trimen; studied
insect fertilization of orchids; in the Auditor-General's office Cape of Good Hope 1860,
subsequently working in various other government departments, part-time curator
South African Museum 1873-1876, full-time id. 1876-1895. (<em>R. Trimen</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BM, OXF.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 401; BB p. 305; BM 5: 2140, 8: 1325; Clokie
p. 256; CSP 6: 40-41, 8: 1116, 11: 645, 12: 740, 19: 204; Desmond p. 618 (b. 29 Oct
1840, d. 25 Jul 1916); Morren ed. 10, p. 114; PH 150.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Entom. mon. Mag. 52: 209-210. 1916 (obit.); Entom. News 28: 338.
	1917 (obit. not.); J. Bot. 54: 279. 1916 (obit. not.); Nat. Nov. 17: 358. 1895
	(retirement); Who's who London 1899-1916; Who was who (London) 1916-1928:
	1054. 1929.

Trimmer, Kirby (1804-1887), British clergyman and botanist; BA Oxford 1828;
curate St. George Tombland, Norwich 1828, idem at Bunham, Norton and Stanhoe,
from 1842 vicar at St. George Tombland. (<em>Trimmer</em>).

Trinchinetti, Augusto (1813-1847), Italian botanist; Dr. med. Pavia 1835, later some-
time professor of botany in Pavia. (<em>Trinchinetti</em>).

Trinius, Carl Bernhard (1778-1844), German (Saxonian) botanist (agrostologist),
physician and poet; studied at Jena, Halle and Leipzig; Dr. chirurg. Göttingen 1802;
state examination medicine Berlin 1803, id. Dorpat 1804, practicing physician in
Gawesen and Hasenpot in Courland (Latvia) 1804-1808; private physician to
Antoinette von Württemberg 1808-1824, travelling widely with her in Russia and
Germany, residing in St. Petersburg 1811-1815, in Witebsk 1816-1822, again in St.
Petersburg from 1822; member of the Academy of Sciences ib. 1823, private court physi-
cian 1824 as well as physician to the Würtemberg family 1824-1844; tutor to the later
Czar Alexander I; first curator of the St. Petersburg botanical collections. (<em>Trin</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Private herbarium (ca. 8000) at MW; grass herbarium and some
other material at LE; – Further material at B (mainly destr.), BR, C, G-DC, H, M, PH,
W. – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL; other letters at G, UPS-UB.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 38: 619-621; AG 2(1): 546; Backer p. 597; Barnhart

PAGE: 494
HEADING: TRINIUS

3: 401 (b. 7 Mar 1778, d. 12 Mar 1844); BM 5: 2141; Bossert p. 406; CSP 6: 42; DTS 1:
306-307; Frank 3 (Anh.): 106; GF p. 78; Hegi 5(2): 1131; Hortus 3: 1205; IH (ed. 6):
365, (ed. 7): 344, 2: (files); Jackson p. 13, 133, 139; Langman p. 746; Lasègue p. 332,
338, 422; Lenley p. 471; Maiwald p. 122; MW p. 502-503; NI 2002; PR 5283, 5284,
7417, 9511-9522, ed. 1: 5856-5857, 8360, 10476-10485; Rehder 5: 861; RS p. 145; SO
add. 826b; TL-1/1334-1337; TL-2/1652, 4499; TR p. 304-307 (nos. 1488-1506); Tucker
1: 701, 3: 312; Urban-Berl. p. 404; Zander ed. 10, p. 725, ed. 11, p. 828.

In a leaflet inserted in the sixth part and dated Mai 1827 it is stated that several of the
earlier lithographs were reissued because of the bad quality of the original edition. Tab.
4 was replaced in fasc. 8, tab. 30 in fasc. 13, tab. 8 in fasc. 18, tab. 2 in fasc. 19, tab. 3 in fasc. 20, tab. 7 in fasc. 21, tab. 10 in fasc. 22, tab. 21 (as Phleum alpinum instead of
Alopecurus alpinus) in fasc. 23, tab. 22 in fasc. 24, tab. 13 in fasc. 25, tab. 12 in fasc. 26.
The 360 lithographs are by W. Pape.
<em>Reissue</em>: 1881; all Hefte except 28 original; no. 28 reprinted (see e.g. Bot. Jahrb. 2: 326.
	17 Nov 1881).

Tristram, Henry Baker (1822-1906), British clergyman, traveller and naturalist; BA
Oxford 1844, naval chaplain Ireland Island, Bermuda 1847-1849, rector of Castle Eden
(Durham) 1849-1860; master of Greatham hospital and vicar of Greatham (Durham)
1860-1874, canon of Durham 1870, resid. 1874; LL.D. Edinburgh 1868; travelled in the
Sahara 1855-1856, 1856-1857, and in Palestine and Egypt 1857-1858 and 1863-1864.
(<em>Tristram</em>).

1822, d. 8 Mar 1906); DNB suppl. 1901-1911, 3: 535-536; Jackson p. 20; Quenstedt p.
436; Rehder 1: 480, 5: xxiv; Tucker 1: 535, 701.

HEADING: TROCHAIN

Trochain, Jean Louis (1903-1976), French botanist, Lic. sci. Toulouse; assistant at the
Faculté des Sciences ib. 1924-1929; assistant Muséum d'Histoire naturelle, Paris 1929-
1943; Maître de conférences Faculté des Sciences, Montpellier 1943-1948, prof. ib. 1948-
1961; from 1961-1975 professor of tropical botany at Toulouse; founder and director of
the Institut d'Études Africaines, Brazzaville 1947-1961. (<em>Troch</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: P, PC (1930-1934 Sénégal), MPU (1946 Sudan), IEC (coll. after
1947); dupl. at P, TL. – <em>Letters</em> at G.

(ed. 5): 185, 186, (ed. 6): 274, 275, 365, (ed. 7): 344; Roon p. 115.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Cat. gén. livr. impr. Bibl. natl. 194: 639-640. 1966; Who's who in
	France 1955-1956: 1587-1588, 1961-1962: 2786, 1963-1964: 2310-2311, 1965-1966:
	2642, 1967-1968: 1350, 1969-1970: 1395-1396, 1971-1972: 1509.
Jacques-Félix, H., J. Agric. trop. Bot. appl. 28: 57-58. 1976.
Staner, P., Acad. R. Sci. Outre-Mer, Annuaire 1977, Bull. Séances 1977(1): 65-67
	(obit., portr.; b. 4 Jun 1903, d. 11 Nov 1976).
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 1: 353. 1935, 2: 2, 27, 30, 129, 131, 385. 1936, 3: 2, 28.
	1937, 4: 299. 1938, 6: 308. 1941.

<em>Promotor</em>: Casimir Christoph Schmidel (1718-1792), see TL-2/4.
<em>Publ</em>.: 1751, p. [1]-58. <em>Copies</em>: B-S, W-ÖNB.
<em>Reprint</em>: <em>in</em> D.C.C. Schmidelii ... <em>Dissertationes botanici argumenti</em> ... 1783, see TL-2/10.859.

Tröndle, Arthur (1881-1920), Swiss (Aargau) botanist; studied at Geneva 1901-1903,
at Freiburg i. Br. 1903-1905 as student of Friedrich Oltmanns; assistant at the Botanical
Institute Basel from 1905-1909; Dr. phil. Basel 1907 with A. Fischer; Privatdozent for
botany at Freiburg i. Br. 1911-1914; habil. Zürich 1915; working at the Zürich Institute
for general botany 1915-1919. (<em>Tröndle</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Ainsworth p. 316; Barnhart 3: 402 (b. 6 Jul 1881, d. 27
Feb 1920); Biol.-Dokum. 18: 9374-9375; Jackson p. 162, 363.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 37: (160). 1919 (1920; d.); Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print.

PAGE: 501
HEADING: TROG

	books 241: 578. 1955; Hedwigia 51: (89). 1911 (Privatdozent Freiburg i. Br.), 62:
	(146). 1921; Österr. bot. Z. 69: 224. 1920 (d.).

Schinz, H., Ber. deut. schweiz. bot. Ges. 30-31: viii. 1920 (b. 6 Jul 1881, d. 26 Feb
	1920).

Trog, Jakob Gabriel (1781-1865), Swiss pharmacist and mycologist; studied phar-
macy in Lausanne, Strasbourg and Paris; assistant pharmacist at Yverdon 1802-1804;
pharmacist at Thun 1804-1834; in retirement dedicating himself to mycology. (<em>Trog</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BE (Rytz 1922; in bad condition); further mycological material
in REG. – <em>Letters</em> at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Ainsworth p. 226, 316, 348; Barnhart 3: 402 (b. 15 Mai
1781, d. 7 Jan 1865); Biol.-Dokum. 18: 9376; BM 5: 2142; CSP 6: 44-45, 8: 1117;
Hawksworth p. 186 Herder p. 246; Kelly p. 220-221; KR 208 (no. 105), 723; LS 2316,
27190-27209; NI 2005-2006; PR 9532-9534, ed. 1: 10496; Stevenson p. 1260.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 241: 581. 1964; Flora 48: 431. 1865

Troilius, Adolf Magnus (1838-1909), Swedish administrator and botanist; Dr. phil.
Uppsala 1860; nominal district judge in Gävle 1866, secretary of the town admini-
stration and public notary ib. 1876-1907. (<em>Troilius</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 402; BJI 2: 556, 725; BM 5: 2142; Jackson p.
337; KR p. 723 (b. 14 Jul 1838, d. 27 Mai 1909); PR 9535; Rehder 1: 355.

15.197. <em>Om Westeråstrakten i botaniskt afseende</em>. Akademisk Afhandling, som med Vidtber-
ömda Filosofiska Fakultetens samtycke for Filosofiska gradens erhållande kommer att
offentligen försvaras af Adolf Magnus Troilius, ... ä mindre Gustafvianska Lärosalen
dagen den [26 Mai, fide KR] 1860 p.v.t.m. Stockholm (Tryckt hos E. Westrell) 1860.

	botaniskt afseende. Utkast af Adolf Magnus Troilius, Stockholm (id.) 1860. Oct.
<em>Follow-up</em>: see BL 2: 556.

Trojan, Johannes (1837-1925), German (Prussian; Danzig) poet, author and amateur
botanist; studied medicine and (later) linguistics in Göttingen, Bonn and Berlin; journa-
list with the Berliner Montagszeitung and with the satirical weekly Kladderadatsch from
1862, editor of Kladderadatsch from 1886-1909; from 1909 in retirement at
Warnemünde and, ultimately, Rostock. (<em>Trojan</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 402 (b. 14 Aug 1837, d. 21 Nov 1915); Biol.-
Dokum. 18: 9377; Futak-Domin p. 616; Rehder 2: 11; Tucker 1: 701.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Allg. bot. Z. 21: 140. 1916 (d.); Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 241:
	607-608. 1964 (wrote e.g. <em>Der Schwarze Peter</em> and <em>Struwelpeter Junior</em>); Deut. Zeitgenos-
	senlexikon 1475-1476. 1905; Hedwigia 57: (151). 1916 (d.); Verh. bot. Ver.
	Brandenburg 57: 244. 1916 (d. 12 Dec 1915; honorary member), 58: 227. 1916 (d.).
Degener, H.A.L., Wer ist's ed. 5. 1491. 1911, ed. 6. 1645. 1912, ed. 7. 1729. 1914, ed. 8.
	1789. 1922 (d. 28 Nov 1925).

	reproduction of his poem for Ascherson); Gartenflora 65: 141-147. 1916 (on T. as a
	botanist; "... verdanke ich seinen sich auf dem Grenzgebiet von Kulturgeschichte
	und Botanik bewegenden Aufsätzen vielfache Anregung und Befriedigung)".

Troll, Carl [Karl] (1899-1975), German (Bavarian) geographer and botanist; Dr. phil.
München with K. von Goebel 1921; habil. ib. (geography) 1925; travelled in South
America 1926-1929; Africa 1933-1934, Himalaya (Nanga Parbat) 1937; professor of
Oversea's and colonial geography, Univ. Berlin 1930; id. economic geogr., Inst. Meere-
skunde, Berlin 1936; professor of geography and director of the Geographisches Institut,
Bonn 1938-1966; younger brother of Wilhelm Troll. (<em>C. Troll</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (Bolivian dupl. extant), M, MEDEL, MJG (292), W. – <em>Letters</em>
at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 402; BFM 5, 2450a; Biol.-Dokum. 18: 9377;
Bossert p. 407; Christiansen p. 105; GR p. 145.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Cat. gén. livr. impr. Bibl. natl. 194: 774-775. 1966; Wer ist's ed. I. 243.
	1948.
Dickinson, R.E., The makers of modern geography 164-166. 1969.

	Arlington, Va. 1967, p. 115-120.
Ives, J.D., &amp; R.G. Barry, ed., Arctic and alpine environments, London 1974 (p. v-vi
	dedication to Troll by Olaf Hedberg).
Kliemann, H.G. &amp; S.S. Taylor, eds., Who's who in Germany ed. 1: 1177. 1956, ed. 2:
	1457. 1960, ed. 3(2): 1757. 1964.

	bibl.) (Festschrift); Erdkunde 30: 1-9. 1976 (biogr., bibl. from 1970); Decheniana,
	Bonn 129: 1-2. 1976 (obit., portr., b. 24 Dec 1899, d. 21 Jul 1975); Ber. bayer. bot.

	vergleichender Erdkunde, Festgabe Erich von Drygalski zum 60. Geburtstag, [307]-

Troll, [Julius Georg Hubertus] Wilhelm (1897-1978), German (Bavarian of Fran-
conian descent) botanist; on active service in World War I 1916-1918; studied natural
sciences at the University of München; Dr. phil. ib. 1921 with K. von Goebel; assistant
at the München Botanical Institute 1923; habil. ib. 1925; botanist on the German
Sunda-Expedition 1928-1930; extraord. prof. bot. München 1931; regular professor of
botany Halle 1932-1945; evacuated to Mainz 1945; professor of botany at the University
of Mainz 1946; active until 1977; leading morphologist; one of the last universal bota-
nists. (<em>Troll</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: MJG; further material in M (lich.).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 402; BFM p. 321-322 (index); Biol.-Dokum.
18: 9278-9380; BJI 2: 179; Bossert p. 407; GR p. 145; Hirsch p. 303; Moebius p. 154,
158, 159; MW p. 503; SK 1: 532; TL-2/2789, see H. Meusel; Tucker 3: 312.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 241: 613-614. 1964; Cat. gén. livr.
	impr. Bibl. natl. 194: 776-780. 1966; Hedwigia 66: (56). 1926 (habil.), 72: (114). 1932
	(e.o. prof. bot. München), 73: (199). 1933 (app. Halle); Österr. bot. Z. 80: 272. 1931
	(app. e.o. prof. bot. München), 81: 320. 1932 (app. Halle).
Behling, L., Ber. bayer. bot. Ges. 50: 119-126. 1979 (obit., portr., bibl.; stress on role of
	humanities in Troll's work).
Degener, A.L., Wer ist's ed. 10. 1623. 1935.
Hecker, U., Mainz naturw. Arch. 17: 154. 1979 (herb. 4429 specimens at MJG, 3809
	coll. by Troll himself).
Kliemann, H.G. &amp; S.S. Taylor, Who's who in Germany ed. 1: 1177. 1956, ed. 2: 1457.
	1960, ed. 3. 2: 1757. 1964.
Kümmel, F., Hercynia 14: 254-256. 1977 (Troll's period at Halle).
Lowden, R.M., Taxon, Index pers. names vols. 1-30. 743. 1984.
Lütjeharms, W.G., Gesch. Mykol. 44, 48. 1936.
Oberschelp, R., Gesamtverz. deut. Schriftt. 134: 204-206. 1980.
Schmid, G., Goethe u.d. Naturw. 618 [index]. 1940.
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 2: 150, 151. 1936, 4: 30, 39, 89, 206, 211. 1938, 5: 38, 72,
	121, 151, 153, 421. 1939; Man. Bryol. 444. 1932; Man. Pteridol. 639. 1938.
Weberling, F., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 94: 311-324. 1981 (obit., portr., bibl., b. 3 Nov 1897,
	d. 28 Dec 1978).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) <em>Bryophyta, in</em> M. Hirmer, <em>Handb. Paläobot</em>. 1927 (TL-2/2789), p.
137-146.
(2) Editor, <em>Hercynia</em>, Abhandlungen der bot. Vereinigung Mitteldeutschlands, 1937-
1944.
(3) <em>Hymenophytum</em>, map 45 with text in E. Hannig &amp; H. Winkler, eds., <em>Pflanzenareale</em> 3(5).
1932.
(4) <em>Gestalt und Gesetz, in</em> Festschrift Karl Goebel, Flora 118-119: 536-565. 1925.
(5) <em>Blatt</em>, in <em>Handw</em>.-<em>Buch Naturw</em>. ed. 2. 1: [102]-1056. 1931.
(6) With I. Haeckel, <em>Botanische Ergebnisse der deutschen Hindukusch-Expedition</em> 1935, Beih.
Repert. sp. nov. 108(1). 1938.
(7) Editor, with O. Renner, <em>Festschrift zum</em> siebzigsten <em>Geburtstage von George Karsten</em>, Flora
n.s. 38, 1933.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Many of Troll's major publications fall outside our period; they are listed by
Behling (1979) and Weberling (1981). For the epochal <em>Die Infloreszenzen</em> see Taxon 14:
168-170. 1965, 19: 117-118. – The <em>Allgemeine Botanik</em> of 1948 saw its fourth edition in
1973. – See also his <em>Gestalt und Urbild</em>, Gesammelte Aufsätze ... Köln, Wien 1984 (Taxon
34: 565. 1984).

250. 1922.

Dr. phil. Lund 1745; lecturer Lund 1746; clergyman 1754; Dr. theol. 1766, professor of
economy Lund 1759-1788. (<em>Trozelius</em>).

Truan y Luard, Alfredo (1837-1890), Swiss-born Spanish photographer, lithographer
and diatomist; trained as photographer in Switzerland, 1853-1863; from 1863 in Gijon,
Spain in charge of a glass factory, and dedicating himself in his spare time to the study
of diatoms. (<em>Truan</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Diatoms at AWH.

True, Rodney Howard (1866-1940), American botanist; student of W.F.P. Pfeffer
1893-1895; Dr. phil. Leipzig 1895; lecturer in pharmacognostic botany, Univ.
Wisconson, Madison 1895; assistant professor ib. 1896-1899; lecturer in botany at
Harvard 1899-1901; plant physiologist with USDA 1902-1920; professor of botany at
Pennsylvania 1920-1937 and director Morris Arboretum ib. 1932-1940. (<em>True</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: PH; further material in MICH, US (144 Alaska, orig.), WIS.

Trumbull, James Hammond (1821-1897), American philologist, historian and bib-
liographer; collaborated with Asa Gray; studied at Yale College 1838; resident of Har-
tford, Conn. from 1847; state librarian 1854, asst. secretary of state 1858-1861, secretary
1861-1865; M.A. Yale 1850; lecturer on Indian languages of North America, Yale
College 1873-1883. (<em>Trumbull</em>).

Trzebinski, Józef [Joseph] (1867-?), Polish phytopathologist and mycologist; studied
natural sciences at the University of Warsaw; Cand. sci. nat. ib. 1894; political prisoner
of the Russian authorities in Warsaw; private teacher at Garwolin; studied pomology
and horticulture at the Proskau Pomological Institute 1898; studied with W.F.P. Pfeffer
at Leipzig; Dr. phil. ib. 1902; assistant to E. Janczewski at Krakow 1900-1904; director
of the mycological section of the Panrussian Society of Sugar manufacturers at Smila
1904-1912; founded the Warsaw Phytopathological Station 1912, director of the
Warsaw University botanical garden 1916-1918, director of the research section of the
phytopathological section of the Pulawy Agronomical institute 1918-1924; professor of
plant taxonomy at the Stefan Batory University, Wilna; in retirement from 1937.
(<em>Trzebinski</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 404; LS 27264, 40093-40109, 41800-41804;
Rehder 1: 368.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Czy wiesz kto to jest? 758-759. 1938; Jahrb. wiss. Bot. 56: 830. 1915
	(student Pfeffer); Katal. literatury naukowej Polskiej 5: 58. 1906, 6: 63. 1907, 7: 21,
	32. 1908, 8: 54. 1909, 9: 22. 1910.
Hryniewiecki, B., Acta Soc. Bot. Polon. 14(4): 249-268. 1937 (biogr., portr., tribute 70th
	birthday, b. 1 Mar 1867); Edward Strasburger 51, 95. 1938.
Szymkiewicz, D., Bibl. fl. Polsk. 33, 136. 1925.

Tschermak-Seysenegg, Erich von (1871-1962), Austrian botanist and zoologist;
grandson of Eduard Fenzl; studied at the University of Vienna and at the Hochschule
für Bodenkultur ib. 1891-1896; continued his studies at the University of Halle; Dr. phil.
Halle 1896; with the Agricultural Stations at Stendal and id. Quedlinburg 1896-1897; in
1898 working at the botanical garden of Gent, Belgium, experimenting with various
types of peas; rediscovered Mendel's laws of heredity independently of but simulta-
neously with Hugo de Vries and Carl Correns (publ. 1900); habil. Wien 1900; lecturer
at the Hochschule für Bodenkultur 1900; assistant to the chair of theoretical plant
breeding 1902; extraordinary professor 1906, full professor 1906-1939, in retirement in
Vienna; Cothenius Medal 1937, Goethe medal 1941, Darwin plaque 1959. (<em>Tschermak</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 405 (b. 15 Nov 1871, d. 11 Oct 1962); Biol.-
Dokum. 18: 9390, 9391, 9393-9395; BJI 2: 179; BM 8: 1329; Bossert p. 407; CSP 19:
220; DSB 13: 477-479 (R. Biebl); LS 27266, 41806, suppl. 28139-28140; Moebius p. 351,
352.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Allg. bot. Z. 7: 20. 1901 (habil.), 9: 212. 1903 (title e.o. prof.), 12: 104.

<em>Publ</em>.: 15-23 Jun 1900 ("wenige Tage vor der Herausgabe [24 Jun 1900] des Juni Heftes
	[of the Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 18(6)]. 1900; ÖbZ for Mai-Jun 1900; Flora 30 Jun 1900;
	Nat. Nov. Jul(2) 1900), p. [i]-iv, 1-91, chart. <em>Copy</em>: B. – Preprinted from Z. landw.

<em>Note</em>: Tschermak's publication of his rediscovery of Mendel's laws. Hugo de Vries pub-
	lished his rediscovery, independent from Tschermak, in Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 18(3): 83-
	90. 25 Apr 1910; Corren's published his rediscovery, also independently, in Ber. deut.
	bot. Ges. 18(5): 158-168. 23 Mai 1910; Tschermak published also a note on his work
	in Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 18(6): 232-239. 24 Jun 1910. He states in his autobiography

PAGE: 516
HEADING: TSCHERMAK

	that the above preprint from the Austrian journal came out just before 24 Jun 1900;
	he also states on p. 355 of his 1900 publication "Die gleichzeitige Entdeckung
	Mendels durch Correns, de Vries ... und mich erscheint mir besonders erfreulich".

15.245. <em>Ueber die gesetzmässige Gestaltungsweise der Mischlinge</em>. (Fortgesetzte Studie an

HEADING: TSCHIRCH

Tschirch, [Wilhelm Oswald] Alexander (1856-1939), German (Prussian) pharma-
cist, botanist and pharmacognosist; studied in Freiburg i.B., Bern and Berlin 1876-1881;
Dr. phil. Freiburg i.B. 1881, student of S. Schwendener; assistant with N. Pringsheim in
Berlin 1881 and assistant at the Berlin Agricultural College 1881; habil. Berlin 1884;
lecturer at the University of Berlin 1885-1890; in Buitenzorg, Dutch East Indies 1889-
1890; extraordinary professor (1890) and regular professor of pharmacognosy and of
pharmaceutical and forensic chemistry at the University of Bern 1891-1932. (<em>Tschirch</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BERN (Java). – <em>Letters</em> at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 405 (b. 17 Oct 1856, d. 2 Dec 1939); BFM
2816, 2884, 2885; Biol.-Dokum. 18: 9398; BJI 1: 58, 2: 180; BM 1: 587, 5: 2146; Bossert
p. 407; Collander p. 526; CSP 11: 655, 12: 742, 19: 221-222; Frank 3 (Anh.): 106;
Herder p. 304; Langman p. 747; LS 27267-27271, 39751, suppl. 28146-28150; Moebius
p. 176, 457; Morren ed. 10, p. 7; MW p. 503; NI 2006a-2006b, index; Rehder 5: 863;
SK 1: 533-534, 4: para. 77, 109; Tucker 1: 702.

Tsiang, Ying (1898-1982), Chinese botanist; professor of botany at the College of
Agriculture of South China, Shek-P'ai, Canton (Guangzhou, Guandong); member of
the editorial board of the Flora reipublicae popularis sinicae and honorary president of
the Botanical Society of China. (<em>Tsiang</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: IBSC; other material at A, C, E, GH, K, NAS, NY, S, SYS, US.

PAGE: 520
HEADING: TSWETT

Tswett, Michael [Michel] Semenovich (1872-1919), Russian (Italy-born) botanist;
studied at Lausanne and Genève; Lic. sci. nat. Genève 1896 as student of M. Thury;
assistant (1901-1902), lecturer (1902-1907) at the University of Warsaw; professor of
botany and agronomy at the Veterinary Institute of Warsaw 1907; professor of botany
and microbiology at the Polytechnic Institute ib. 1908-1915; professor of botany at
Dorpat 1917; specially interested in botanical chromatography. (<em>Tswett</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – <em>Letters</em> at G.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: The author used the spelling Tsvett in his later works. Wrote to J. Briquet (19
Mar 1897) "Vous devez me considérer plutôt comme un compatriote que comme le
Russe que je ne suis pas". – Major work: <em>Les chromophylles dans les mondes végétal et animal</em>,
Warsaw 1910, 380 p. (in Russian, Achmatov prize). For a contemporary account of his
work see DSB (1976).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 406 (b. 29 Mai 1872, d. Mai 1920); Biol.-
Dokum. 18: 9408; DSB 13: 486-488 (E.M. Senchenkova).

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 37: (160). 1919 (1920), (d. Mai 1920, err.); Bot.
	Centralbl. 110: 160. 1909 (app. Warsaw), 119: 176. 1912 (Achmatov Prize); Bot. Not.
	1920: 126; Mycol. Centralbl. 1: 65. 1912 (Achmatov Prize); Nat. Nov. 31: 191. 1909
	(app. Warsaw); Österr. bot. Z. 59: 127. 1909 (app. Warsaw), 70: 64. 1921 (d.), 72:
	124. 1923 (d. in Woronesh).
Briquet, J., Bull. Soc. bot. Suisse 50a: 463-466. 1940 (biogr. sketch, detailed bibl. 56
	nos.).
Dhéré, C., Candollea 23-73. 1946 (account of work).
Miège, J., Musées de Genève 133: 18-22. 1973 (biogr. sketch, portr., evaluation of
	chromatographical work; d. 26 Jun 1919 at Voronesh).
Morton, A.G., Hist. bot. Sci. 450. 1981.
Williams, T.I., Biogr. dict. Scient. 520-521. 1969; Endeavour 31(112): 2. 1972 (chroma-
	tographic centenary).
Zechmeister, L., Isis 36(2): 108-109. 1946.

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Candollea 10: 30. 1946.

Tubeuf, Carl [Karl] [Freiherr] von (1862-1941), German (Franconian) botanist;
studied at the Forestry College, Aschaffenburg 1883 and the University of München
1885; Dr. phil. München 1886; with the Karlsruhe Polytechnic 1887; botanical assistant
at the Forestry Research Institute München; habil. Univ. München 1888, Techn.
Hochschule 1892; head of the botanical laboratory of the "Land- und Forstwissenschaft-
liche kaiserliche Gesundheitsamte" Berlin 1898-1902, from 1901 as director of the
Biology department; "Regierungsrath" 1899; professor of forestry science at the Univ-
ersity of München 1902-1933. (<em>Tub</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – Some lichens at M. – <em>Letters</em> at FH, G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Ainsworth p. 126, 283, 348; Barnhart 3: 406; Biol.-
Dokum. 18: 9408-9409; BL 1: 58, 2: 180; BM 5: 2147-2148, 8: 1330; Bossert p. 408
("Simon Carl von ...); CSP 49: 224; DTS 1: 307, 3: liii, 6(4): 202; GR p. 146; Hirsch p.
305; Hortus 3: 1205; Kelly p. 230; Langman p. 747; LS 27274-27364, 40112-40145,
41807, suppl. 28154-28181; Moebius p. 279; MW p. 505; Plesch p. 441; Rehder 5: 863-
864; Saccardo 2: 110; Stevenson p. 1260; TL-2/see Will. G. Smith; Tucker 1: 702, 3:
313; Zander ed. 10, p. 725, ed. 11, p. 828.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 76: 352. 1898 (to Berlin), 80: 31. 1899 (Regierungsrath),
	88: 127. 1901 (director biology division of Berlin institute); Nat. Nov. 20: 595. 1898
	(to Berlin), 24: 187. 1902 (to München, replacing R. Hartig); Österr. bot. Z. 48: 470.
	1898 (to Berlin), 49: 414. 1899 (Regierungsrath).

Degener, H.A.L., Wer ist's eds. 4-10, 1909-1935.

15.266. <em>Samen, Früchte und Keimlinge</em> der in Deutschland heimischen oder eingeführten
forstlichen Culturpflanzen. Ein Leitfaden zum Gebrauche bei Vorlesungen und Uebun-
gen der Forstbotanik, zum Bestimmen und Nachschlagen für Botaniker, studirende und
ausübende Forstleute, Gärtner und andere Pflanzenzüchter ... Berlin (Verlag von Julius

Tucker, Clarence Mitchell (1897-1954), American botanist; B.S. Agr. Univ. Missouri
1920; Dr. phil. ib. 1930; professor of plant pathology Univ. Puerto Rico 1920-1923; id.
in the Puerto Rico Agric. Experiment Station Mayaguez 1923-1930; associate plant
pathologist Florida Agricultural Experiment Station 1930-1931; plant pathologist and
associate professor of botany, University of Missouri 1931-1937, full professor ib. 1937-
1954. (<em>Tucker</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Tuckerman, Edward (1817-1886), American botanist, B.A. Union Coll. 1837; LL.D.
Harvard College 1839; travelled in Europe 1841-1842; B.A. Harvard 1847; in Harvard
Divinity School 1847-1852; lecturer in history at Amherst College 1854-1855; professor
of oriental history 1855-1858; professor of botany ib. 1858-1886 (also lecturing in history
1858-1873); outstanding lichenologist. (<em>Tuck</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: FH (lichens), phanerogams at MASS and UPS. – Other material
in BM (Potamogeton; phan.), BP, BR, BUF, CGE, DBN, DWC, E, FI, GRA, H, HH,
KIEL, M, MANCH, MASS, MSC, NHA, NY, NYS, PH, UPS, US, W, WECO,
WELC. – <em>Letters</em> at FH (numerous), G, GH(125), H-UB (53, to W. Nylander), HAL,
MASS, NY, US. <em>Original drawings</em> at FH. – <em>Lichenological library</em> left to Amherst College. –
<em>Exsiccatae</em>: (1) <em>Lichenes Americae septentrionalis exsiccati</em>, nos. 1-150, fasc. 1-6, 1847-1854
(details see Sayre, 1969). – Sets at B (mainly destr.), BM, C, DPU, FH, HAL, L, NY,
O, PC, US.
(2) Caroli Wright, <em>Lichenes insulae Cubae</em> curante E. Tuckerman, nos. 1-246, Boston 1864.
Sets at FH, NY and UPS (details see Sayre 1969 and see entry under Ch. Wright).

657, 12: 743, 19: 227; DAB 19: 42-44 (W.R. Maxon); Frank 3 (Anh.): 106; GR p. 197-

HEADING: TURCKHEIM

	<em>1</em>: p. [i]-xvi, 1-518. Contains nearly all Tuckerman publications on lichens, except for
	the <em>Synopsis</em> (2 vols., 1882, 1888) and the <em>Genera lichenum</em> (1872).
	<em>2</em>: not independently paginated, contains the <em>Synopsis</em> (2 vols., 1882, 1888) and the
	<em>Genera lichenum</em> (1872).
<em>Excluded</em>: The treatment of the Lichens <em>in</em> M.A. Curtis, <em>Botany</em>, Geol.-nat. Hist. Surv. N.
	Carol. 3, 1867. – This treatment has been attributed to Tuckerman, but he himself
	refused to acknowledge this (Culberson 1961).

Tuckey, James Hingston (1776-1816), British commander in the navy and explorer;
in the British navy from 1793, lieutenant 1800, first lieutenant 1802; on the Calcutta to
New South Wales to survey Port Philipp 1802-1804; in French captivity 1805-1814,
commander 1814; on the Congo to the Zaire river 1816. (<em>Tuckey</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: The collections made by Christian Smith and David Lockhart
"from the vicinity of the Congo", collected 1816 and worked up by Robert Brown are at
BM.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: The second Christian name of Tuckey is consistently misspelled "Kingston" in the
<em>Narr. exped. Zaire</em> 1818 (and also by us in TL-2/5: 668, 1064).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BM 5: 2149; DNB 19: 1212-1213 ("James Kingston
..."); Jackson p. 346; Lasègue p. 444; PR 1225, 9552, ed. 1: 1368, 10523; Rehder 5: 864;
RS p. 145; TL-1/1338; TL-2/12.190, see C. Smith; Tucker 1: 703.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Allibone, S.A., Crit. dict. Engl. lit. 3: 2468. 1880.
Anon., Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 242: 143. 1964; Cat. gén. livr. impr. 195: 832-
	833. 1966.
Bridson, G.D.R. et al., Nat. hist. mss. res. Brit. Isl. 224.534. 1980.
Ferguson, J.A., Bibl. Australia 1: 165. 1941.
Hoefer, Nouv. biogr. gén. 45: 692-693. 1866.
J.V.C.-B., Austral. encycl. 2: 599. 1926, 9: 56. s.d.
Poggendorff, J.C., Biogr.-lit. Handw.-Buch 2: 1144-1145. 1863.
Robert, W.C.H., Contr. bibl. Austral. South Sea Isl. ed. 2: 309. 1970.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: <em>An account of a voyage to establish a colony at Port Philip</em> in Bass's Strait ...
in the years 1802-1804. London 1805, <em>List of plants</em> on p. 218-219. – See Ferguson (1941)
for further details. – <em>German transl</em>.: 1805, Bericht von einer Reise nach Neu-Süd-Wallis
... Weimar (... Landes-Industrie Comptoir).

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: The derivation of <em>Tuckeya</em> Gaudichaud-Beaupre (1841) could not be
determined.

15.287. <em>Narrative of an expedition to explore the river Zaire</em>, usually called the Congo, in South
Africa, in 1816, under the direction of Captain J.K. [sic, for H.] Tuckey, R.N. To which
is added the journal of professor Smith; some general observations on the country and its
inhabitants; and an appendix: containing the natural history of that part of the kingdom
of Congo through which the Zaire flows. Published by the Lords Commissioners of the
Admiralty. London (John Murray, ...) 1818. Qu. (<em>Narr. exped. Zaire</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 5 Mar 1818 (see Stearn 1961), p. [i*-vii*], [i]-lxxxii, [1]-498, map, <em>pl. 1-14. Copies</em>:
	BR, H-UB, HH, MO, NSUB, PH, USDA; IDC 150. – <em>Appendix 5</em>: <em>Observations, sys-
	tematical and geographical</em>, on professor Christian Smith's collection of plants from the
	vicinity of the River Congo, by Robert Brown, F.R.S., on p. 420-485. – Plants collec-
	ted by Christen [sic] Smith (1785-1816) and his assistant David Lockhart (x-1846).
	For Robert Brown (1773-1858) see TL-2/1: 364-369. – A reprint of the appendix,
	published separately London 1818, p. 1-66 is mentioned in the literature.
<em>Facsimile ed</em>.: London (Cass) 1967 (n.v.).
<em>Ref</em>.: Stearn, W.T., Taxon 10: 237-238. 1961.

Türckheim, Hans [Freiherr] von (1853-1920), German (Baden) plant collector and
traveller; studied law at Strassburg and Berlin; state examinator 1876; for a short time

PAGE: 528
HEADING: TURCKHEIM

administrator in Ellrich a. Harz and Delitzsch, shortly afterwards to Guatemala in
charge of a coffee plantation ca. 1878-1908; in retirement at Karlsruhe from 1908;
collected in Santo Domingo 1909-1910. (<em>Türckh</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (mainly destr.) and US (through J. Donnell Smith). Other
material (mainly from Guatemala): A, AMES, BHU, BM, BP, BR, C, COLU, E, F, G,
GB, GH, GOET, H, ILL, ISC, JE, K, L, M, MANCH, MICH, MO, NY, P, PH, S, SI,
STU, U, VT, W, WU, WRSL, WU, Z. – J.D. Smith distributed a great number of
Türckheim's Guatemala collections with printed labels (which formed the basis of his
<em>Enum. pl. Guatem.</em> 1-8, 1889-1907) in eight series distributed among the major herbaria of
the world from 1887 onward as <em>Plantae guatemalenses Tuerckheimianae</em> (sets at B, GH, K,
NY, P, US; see footnote Bot. Gaz. 12: 131. 1887). Türckheim sent also collections
directly, e.g. bryophytes between 1885 and 1888. The Santo Domingo collections are
described by I. Urban in his <em>Flora domingensis</em> in Symb. ant. vol. 8. T. also sent Orchids
directly to R. Schlechter (also at B). T.'s private herbarium went to B after his death. –
<em>Letters</em> to K. Keck at UPS-UB, other letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BM 5: 2149; Bossert p. 408; IH (ed. 7): 342; Morren ed.
10, p. 138; TL-2/12.295, see J.D. Smith; Urban-Berl. p. 272, 315, 405.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Allg. bot. Z. 12: 168. 1906 (again collecting in Guatemala); Bot. Cen-
	tralbl. 111: 240. 1909 (collecting trip to San Domingo and Guatemala planned; Bot.
	Monatschr. 22: 112. 1911 (returned from San Domingo); Bot. Zeit. 37: 759. 1879 (K.
	Keck will distribute Guatemala coll. by V.T.; identifications by F. Kurtz); Deut.
	entom. Z. 37: 12. 1893 (d.).
Honrath, E.G., Berl. entom. Z. 37: 511-512. 1893 (obit.).
Kneucker, A., Gartenflora 70: 19-22. 1921 (obit.); Mitt. Bad. Landesver. Naturk. ser. 2.
	1(6): 152. 1921; Allg. Bot. Z. 24-25: 33-36. 1922.
Lack, H.W. &amp; C.-O. von Sydow, Willdenowia 14: 443. 1984 (letters to K. Keck at UPS-
	UB).
Müller Hal., K., Bryologia guatemalensis 1897 (TL-2/6516; Türckheim material
	described).
Sayre, G., Mem. New York Bot. Gard. 19(3): 406. Mai 1975 (on general coll.).

	of 500 species, identified by I. Urban).
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 1: 446. 1935, 4: 565. 1939, 5: 427. 1941.
Wagenitz, G., Index coll. princ. herb. Gott. 167. 1982.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: See J.D. Smith, <em>Enumeratio plantarum guatemalensium</em> imprimis a H. de
Tuerckheim collectarum ... 1889-1907. See TL-2/12.295.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Tuerckheimia</em> V.F. Brotherus (1910); <em>Tuerckheimocharis</em> Urban (1912).

15.288. <em>Botanische Forschungsreise in Santo Domingo</em> in den Jahren 1909 und 1910. ...
Separatabdruck aus "Allgemeine Botanische Zeitschrift" ... Goslar (Verlag von Carl
Loeffel) 1911. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1911 (in issues for Jul-Aug and Sep 1911), p. [1]-11. <em>Copies</em>: G, US. – Reprinted
	and to be cited from Allg. bot. Z. 17(7-8): 101-106. Jul-Aug, (9): 129-135. Sep 1911.

Tüxen, Reinhold (1899-1980), German (Schleswig) botanist (phytosociologist);
studied chemistry in Heidelberg; Dr. phil. ib. 1925; in charge of nature conservation at
the "Provinzialstelle für Naturdenkmalpflege" with the Provincial Museum at Han-
nover 1926; founder of the "Floristisch-soziologische Arbeitsgemeinschaft in Niedersach-
sen" 1927; director of the "Zentralstelle für Vegetationskartierung" 1939 at Hannover,
the latter from 1943 in Stolzenau, from 1947-1964 as Bundesanstalt für Vegetat-
ionskunde; from 1964 in retirement at Rinteln. (<em>Tüxen</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: GOET.

PAGE: 529
HEADING: TULASNE

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BFM p. 322; Biol.-Dokum. 18: 9411-9413; BJI 2: 181;
Christiansen p. 320 [index]; GR p. 146; IF (ed. 2): 115, (ed. 3): 147, (ed. 4): 164, (ed.
5): 176.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Hedwigia 78: (157). 1939 (professor's title); Taxon 29: 701. 1980 (d.).
Barkman, J., Vegetatio 48(1): 87-91. 1981 (obit.).

Tulasne, Charles (1816-1884), French botanist and physician; studied medicine in
Paris 1840, practicing ib. until 1865; from then with his brother L.R. Tulasne at Hyères,
S. France 1865-1884; assisted his brother with botanizing and especially with the ill-
ustration of the latter's works. (<em>C. Tul</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: P, PC. – See further under L.R. Tulasne.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 407 (b. 5 Sep 1816, d. 21 Aug 1844); BM 5:
2149; Bossert p. 408; CSP 6: 62, 8: 1126; Frank 3 (Anh.): 106-107; Lenley p. 416; LS

PAGE: 530
HEADING: TULASNE

27434-27447; NI 2007-2010; PR alph.; Rehder 5: 864; Stevenson p. 1260; TL-1/329g;
TL-2/1598, 10.681, 10.683, see C.L. Shear.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Zeit. 42: 844. 1884 (d.); Bull. Soc. bot. France 31 (bibl.): 112. 1884
	(d.); Nat. Nov. 6: 234. 1884 (d.); Rev. bot. Bull. mens. Soc. Franç. Bot. 3: 286. 1885
	(d.); Science 5: 62. 1885.
Dufresne, E., Edmond et Charles Tulasne, Lyon, Genève 1892, 88 p. (reprinted from
	l'Université Catholique; journal version n.v.). Main source for Charles T.
Jovet-Ast, S., Bull. Soc. mycol. France 100: clxxvii-ccv. 1984 (portr.).
Mägdefrau, K., Gesch. Bot. 172. 1973.
Wittrock, V.B., Acta Horti Berg. 3(3): 116, 142. 1905 (portr.).

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Tulasneinia</em> Zobel ex Corda (1854), <em>Tulasnella</em> J. Schroeter (1888) and <em>Tulas-
nodea</em> E.M. Fries (1849) all also honor L.R. Tulasne (<em>q.v</em>.).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Many of the biographical and bibliographical references listed below under L.R.
Tulasne also deal with his brother Charles.

Tulasne, Louis-René ["Edmond"] (1815-1885), French botanist; studied law, Lic.
jur. 1885, public notary ib. 1835-1839; settled in Paris 1839-1965 as a private scientist
dedicating himself to botany (from 1842-1865 research associate "aide-naturaliste" at
the Muséum d'Histoire naturelle), charity and the Christian religion; in retirement in
Hyères, S. France 1865-1885. (<em>Tul.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: P, PC (donated 1865); other material in FI (types), W. – <em>Library</em>
donated to the Université catholique, Paris 1865. – <em>Letters</em> at G.

<sm>NAME</sm>: Signed his letters "Edmond", and is mentioned as Louis Réné Edmond Étienne
in Ann. Sci. nat. ser. 10, 16: liii. Dufresne (1892), a close friend of the brothers, states
that "within the family he was given the name Edmond" even though his official names
were Louis-René (sometimes mentioned a E.L.R. Tulasne, see TL-2/5: 1064).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Ainsworth p. 348; Backer p. 662; Barnhart 3: 407 (b. 12
Sep 1815, d. 22 Sep 1885); BM 5: 2149; CSP 6: 62-63, 8: 1126, 19: 229; DSB 13: 489-490
(G. Viennot-Bourgin); GR <em>pl</em>. [<em>31</em>], cat. p. 72; Hawksworth p. 186, 198; Herder p. 481;
Hortus 3: 1205; IH 1 (ed. 6): 365, (ed. 7): 344; Jackson p. 137, 140, 160, 163, 371; Kelly
p. 230-231, 259; KR p. 725; Langman p. 747-748; Lasègue p. 102, 296; Lenley p. 416;
LS 27405-27447; Moebius p. 99, 109, 112, 113; Morren ed. 2, p. 18, 21, ed. 10, p. 55;
MW p. 505; NI 2007-2010; PR 9553-9556; SBC p. 133; Stevenson p. 1260; TL-1/329g;
TL-2/1598, 292110.681, 10.683, see C.L. Shear; Tucker 1: 703.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bonplandia 1: 34, 52, 110, 167, 187, 261. 1853, 2: 37, 189. 1854, 5: 267.
	1857, 6: 54. 1858, 8: 171. 1860; Bot. Centralbl. 25: 131. 1886 (d.); Bot. Gaz. 11: 71.
	1886 (obit. not.); Bot. Zeit. 11: 72. 1853 (Acad.), 30: 692. 1872 (retirem.); Bull. Soc.
	bot. France 23 (bibl.): 190. 1876 (donates library to Catholic University of Paris), 32
	(bibl.): 234. 1885 (obit. not.); Cat. gén. livr. impr. Bibl. natl. 195: 903-904. 1966;
	Flora 40: 624. 1857 (memb. Leopoldina); Grand Larousse encycl. 10: 543. 1964;
	Leopoldina 21: 215-216. 1885 (obit.); Nat. Nov. 8: 32. 1886 (d.); Proc. Linn. Soc.
