Vouk, Vale [Valentin] (1886-1962), Croatian botanist; student of R. v. Wettstein
1905-1908; Dr. phil. Wien 1908; demonstrator at Institute for plant physiology Wien
1910-1912; Habil. Zagreb (Agram) 1913; extraordinary professor of botany ib. 1915-
1918, ord. professor 1918, head professor from 1928-1959. (<em>Vouk</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 445 (b. 21 Mar 1886); Biol.-Dokum. 18:
9657; Bossert p. 421 (d. 1962); GR p. 783; Hirsch p. 313 ("Valentin"); IH 1 (ed. 1):
105, (ed. 2): 129, (ed. 3): 167; LS 40317-40318, suppl. 9998, 29012-29024; Moebius p.
201; SIA 7097; Tucker 1: 724-725.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Allg. bot. Z. 14: 164. 1908 (demonstrator Wien); Bot. Centralbl. 122:
	160. 1913 (app. Zagreb)), 129: 656. 1915(app. prof.); Enciklop. leksikogr. zavoda,
	Zagreb, 7: 692. 1964; Hedwigia 54: (126), (189). 1913 (habil. Zagreb), 55: (72). 1914
	(in charge of bot. phys. inst. Zagreb), 58: (89). 1916 (professor and director id.); Ko
	je ko u Jugoslaviji 773. 1957; Österr. bot. Z. 63: 48. 1913 (app. Zagreb), 65: 360. 1915

<em>Publ</em>.: Mar 1914 (ÖbZ for Mar 1914), p. [i, recto of 46], [46]-68. <em>Copy</em>: B. – Reprinted

<em>Publ</em>.: 1936, p. [i], [1]-47, <em>pl. 1-9. Copy</em>: USDA. – Issued as Acta adriat. Split 8. 1936.

Vries, Hugo de (1848-1935), Dutch botanist (plant physiologist and geneticist);
studied natural sciences at Leiden University 1866-1870; Dr. phil. 1870; high school
teacher at Assen 1870; with Wilhelm Hofmeister at Heidelberg 1870-1871, with J. Sachs
at Würzburg 1871; high school teacher at Amsterdam 1871-1875; working at Würzburg
on publications on agricultural plants 1875-1877; "Privatdozent" Halle 1877; lecturer
(1877) and professor of botany at the University of Amsterdam 1878-1918; in retirement
working on Oenothera at Lunteren 1918-1935; drew attention to the Mendel laws con-
currently with C.F.J.E. Correns and E. von Tschermak (1900); visited the United States
in 1904, 1906 and 1912. (<em>de Vries</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: A herbarium of <em>Oenothera</em> mutants, was deposited in the Nederl.

PAGE: 788
HEADING: VRIES

Hist. Natuurw. Museum; 11 specimens of Oenothera were at B (destr.). On the whole
de Vries is said not to have held herbaria in high regard; archival material at AMD
(Archief de Vries), Museum Boerhaave, Leiden and Biohist. Inst. Utrecht. – <em>Letters</em> e.g.
at FH, G, GH, KNAW, UPS-UB.

<sm>MAIN BIOGRAPHY AND BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm>: P.H.W.A.M. de Veer, <em>Leven en werk van Hugo de
Vries</em>, Groningen 1969, 252 p. This work contains also a good choice of secondary re-
ferences. See also Margadant (1979) and P.W. van der Pas (DSB, 1976) for instructive
and well documented accounts.

<sm>COLLECTED WORKS</sm>: <em>Opera e periodicis collata</em>, vols. 1-7, Utrecht 1918-1927, see below;
contains reprints of a large number of periodical articles. This reprint is indicated in our
entries as "Opera".

<sm>FORMAL ORATIONS</sm>: In acceptance of the appointment as e.o. professor of botany, Univ.
Amsterdam, 15 Oct 1878: <em>De Ademhaling der planten</em>, Haarlem 1878, 24 p.; address as
rector magnificus Univ. Amsterdam 8 Jan 1898: <em>Eenheid in Veranderlijkheid</em>. beschouwin-
gen op het gebied der erfelijkheid, Haarlem 1898, 16 p.; farewell address on retirement
13 Jun 1918: <em>Van Amoebe tot mensch</em>. Utrecht 1918, 18 p. (portr.).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 445 (b. 16 Feb 1848, d. 25 Mai 1935); Biol.-
Dokum. 18: 9658-9660; BJI 1:61, 2: 185; BL 2: 435, 728; BM 5: 2240, 8: 1379; Bossert p.
422; CSP 8: 1175, 11: 725-726, 2: 761, 19: 411-412; De Toni 1: xxxiii-xxxiv, 4: xix; DSB
14: 95-105 (P.W. v.d. Plas); Ewan ed. 2: 229; Frank 3 (Anh.): no; Herder p. 125;
Hirsch p. 313; Hortus 3: 1191; Jackson p. 73, 78, 81, 91; JW 1: 449, 451, 2: 203, 3: 374-
375, 4: 413 (further sec. refs.); KR p. 737; Lenley p. 425; Moebius 457 (index); Morren
ed. 2, p. 28, ed. 10, p. 90; Plesch p. 453; Rehder 5: 891-892; Sotheby 202, 837; TL-2/see
indexes; Tucker 1: 725, 3: 324; Urban-Berl. p. 407; Zander ed. 11, p. 741.

Vriese, Willem Hendrik de (1806-1862), Dutch botanist; studied medicine in Leiden
1825-1830; Dr. med. Leiden 1830; practicing physician and lecturer at the Rotterdam
medical school 1831-1834; professor of botany at the University of Amsterdam 1834-
1845; from 1845 id. Leiden 1845-1862; travelled in the Dutch East Indies 1858-1861. (<em>de
	Vriese</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: L (herb. acquired 1863); other material AA, CGE, K, MICH,
MO, P, U, W. – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL, to F.A.M. Miquel at U, to
Asa Gray at GH; further letters at G, UPS-UB. Archival material relating to East
Indian journey 1857-1862 in Dutch Natl. Archives.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Aa 19: 454; Backer p. 170; Barnhart 3: 445 (b. 11 Aug
1806, d. 23 Jan 1862); BM 5: 2240-2241; Bossert p. 422; CSP 6: 208-210, 8: 1175; Frank
3 (Anh.): 109; GF p. 79-80; Herder p. 483 [index]; Hortus 3: 1191; IF p. 736; IH 1 (ed.
2): 70, (ed. 3): 87, (ed. 6): 365, (ed. 7): 345; Jackson p. 77, 117, 132, 138, 147, 152, 397,
440, 441; JW 1: 449, 451, 2: 203, 3: 374; Langman p. 786; Lasègue p. 547; Moebius p.
274; MW p. 517-518, suppl. p. 386; NI 2083-2090; PR 848, 8672, 9855-9879, 10229,
10666, ed. 1: 10841-10855; Rehder 5: 892-893; SK 1: 552-553 (itin., sec. ref., portr.), 4:
clxi (index), 5: cccxxx; TL-1/513, 867, 1372-1375; TL-2/1455, 2874, 4001, 4332, 6094,
6107, 6111, 6132, 11.950, see F.A.W. Miquel, P. Harting; Tucker 1: 725-726; Zander
ed. 10, p. 651, ed. 11, p. 741.

PAGE: 793
HEADING: VRIESE

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Alg. Konst-Letterbode 1831(1): 50 (appointed at Medical School
	Rotterdam), 1834(2): 322 (inaugural address Amsterdam 10 Nov 1834), 1845(2): 49
	(app. Leiden), 224 (inaugural address ib. 26 Sep 1845), 1855(29): 229 (decoration);
	Bonplandia 2: 191. 1854 (in London), 3: 35. 1855 (cogn. Leopoldina: Wachendorff),
	5: 16. (publ. Reinward's plants), 29 (single editor Ned. kruidk. Archief after Dozy's
	death), 332 (in London). 1857, 6: 54. 1858, 9: 189-190. 1861 (on his Exp. to East
	Indies), 10: 47, 219. 1862 (d.); Bot. Zeit. 16: 68. 1858 (Suringar replaces R.), 20: 48.
	1862 (d. by Dysenterica tropica), 20: 176. 1862 (Miquel succeeds R. as dir.
	Rijksherbarium); Bull. Soc. bot. France 8: 655-656. 1862 (obit. not.); Flora 29: 48.
	1846 (called to Leiden), 490: 735. 1857 (to East Indies), 41: 224. 1858 (Suringar
	replaces R. in Leiden); Fl. males. Bull. 34: 3547. 1981 (large mss. files on his travels in
	the Dutch East Indies in the Dutch National Archives); J. Bot. 1: 64. 1863 (obit.
	not.); Österr. bot. Z. 12: 94. 1862 (d.).

	1825, d. 6 Dec 1906).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Editor, with J. v.d. Hoeven, <em>Tijdschr. nat. geschied.</em> 1834-1845, 12
vols., see TL-2/2871.
(2) Preface to K.S. Kunth's <em>Handboek der botanie</em> 1836, see TL-2/4001.
(3) Co-author with G. Bentham, W.J. Hooker &amp; J. Lindley, of <em>A systematical list of the
principal plants, in</em> T.L. Mitchell, <em>J. exped. trop. Australia</em> 1848, TL-2/6132.
(4) Contributed to J.G.C. Lehmann, <em>Pl. Preiss.</em> 1844-1847, TL-2/4332.
(5) Co-founder and co-editor, <em>Nederlandsch kruidkundig Archief</em> 1846-1861, vols. 1-5(2).
(6) Co-author and in part co-editor, F.A.W. Miquel, <em>Pl. jungh.</em> 1853-1855, TL-2/6107.
(7) Editor and author of biography (p. 1-98, 223-266): <em>Reis naar het oostelijk gedeelte van
den Indischen Archipel</em> in het jaar 1821; door C.G.C. Reinwardt. Uit zijne nagelaten
aanteekeningen opgesteld, met een levensbericht en bijlagen vermeerderd; door W.H.
de Vriese ... Amsterdam (Frederik Muller) 1858; editing completed by J. Pijnappel.
(8) Editor, with P.F. von Siebold, <em>Annales d'horticulture et de botanique</em>, Leiden 1857-1860, 3
vols., see P.F. von Siebold.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Neovriesia</em> N.L. Britton (1923); <em>Vriesea</em> J.K. Hasskarl (1842, <em>nom. rej.</em>); <em>Vriesea</em>
["Vriesia] Lindley (1843, <em>nom. cons.</em>).

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Fl. males. ser. I. 1: clii. 1950.

therapeutice naturalis, ad sanandos corporis humani morbos chronicos ... ad diem xx.
decembris, mdcccxxx, ... Lugduni Batavorum [Leiden] (apud C.C. van der Hoek)
1830. Oct., p. [i-viii], [1]-127, 96 [on verso of 127], [1, err.]. <em>Copy</em>: U.

PAGE: 794
HEADING: VRIESE

ingana anno [1826] propositam; qua quaeritur: "Quid hactenus ex plantarum physi-

possint?" quae praemium reportavit. Groningae (apud I. Oomkens, ...) 1829. Qu. (<em>Resp. quest. bot.</em>).

16.420. <em>Illustrations d'Orchidées des Indes orientales Néerlandaises</em>, ou choix de plantes

	technische Ausführung ist ja ... nicht viel besser als Arrabida's [Vellozo] fl. flumi-
	nensis!" [Fenzl to Miquel, 12 Dec 1857].

Vrolik, Gerardus (1775-1859), Dutch physician and botanist; Dr. phil. Leiden 1796;
professor of botany at the Amsterdam Athenaeum 1796, from 1798 also temporarily in
charge of the teaching of obstetrics. (<em>Vrolik</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – <em>Letters</em> at G.

Moebius p. 274; NNBW 3: 1366-1367 (Sasse); PR 9880-9886, ed. 1: 10856-10861,
11837; Rehder 5: 893; TL-1/1376; Tucker 1: 726.

Vuillemin, [Jean] Paul (1861-1933), French mycologist; studied at the University of
Nancy; Dr. méd. Nancy 1884; Lic.-ès-Sci. ib. 1889; Dr. sci. Sorbonne 1892; professor of
natural history at the medical faculty Nancy 1895-1932. (<em>Vuill</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some material at PAD, PAV. – <em>Letters</em> at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Ainsworth p. 348 [index]; Barnhart 3: 445 (b. 13 Feb
1861, d. 29 Jun 1932); BJI 2: 185; BL 2: 181, 728; BM 5: 2242; Bossert p. 422; CSP 19:
414-415; GR p. 356; Hawksworth p. 186; Herder p. 307; Kelly p. 233-235; Langman p.
786; LS 1796, 28015-28119, 40319-403413, suppl. 29039-29070; Rehder 5: 893-894;
Stevenson p. 1261; Tucker 1: 726.

	impr. Bibl. natl. 215: 867-874. 1972; Hedwigia 35: (35). 1896 (app. Nancy), 42:
	(162). 1903 (prix Montagne), 54: (61). 1913 (corr. memb. Acad. Sci. Paris); J. Bot.

	(corr. memb. Acad. Sci. Paris); Qui êtes-vous 1924: 764.

Vukotinovic, Ludwig [Ljudevit] von Farkaš (1813-1893), Croatian politician,
magistrate and botanist; asst. judge in Pressburg (Bratislava) 1836, judge 1840; member
of the diet of Croatia 1847; in the Croatian National Guard 1848-1850; judge at Križ-
evci (Kreuz) 1850-1853; privately active in Agram (Zagreb) 1853-1860; co-founder of
the Croatian Museum; prefect of the Križevci district 1860-1867; from 1867 private
politician and scientist. (<em>Vuk</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: ZA; further material in BP and W. – <em>Letters</em> to K. Keck at UPS-
UB; other letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 6(1): 282; Barnhart 1: 526 (b. 13 Jan 1813, d. 17
Mar 1893); BM 5: 2243; CSP 6: 213-214, 8: 1176, 11: 726, 12: 762-763, 19: 416; Herder
p. 193; Hortus 3: 1206; Jackson p. 265, 266; PR 2816-2818; Rehder 5: 894; TL-2/6725;
Tucker 1: 726; WU 52: 27-30.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 24: 385. 1885 (donated his herbarium to ZA), 54: 127.
	1893 (d.); Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 250: 804. 1964; Mala encicl. Prosveta 1:
	379. 1978; Österr. bot. Z. 12: 402. 1862, 39: 158. 1889 (herb. specimens to W), 40:
	140. 1890 (id.), 43: 152. 1893 (d.); Znameniti i zaslužni hrvati 285. 1925.
Harrassowitz, O., ed., Kleine Slavische Biographie 769-770. 1958.
Knapp, J.A., Österr. bot. Z. 29: 1-7. 1879 (biogr. sketch, list publ., portr.).
Kovacevic, S., Album zaslužnih hrvata, Zagreb [6 p.] 1898-1900.
Lack, H.W. &amp; C.-O. von Sydow, Willdenowia 14: 444. 1984.
Poggendorff, J.C., Biogr.-lit. Handw.-Buch 3: 1403. 1898.
Wittrock, V.B., Acta Horti Berg. 3(2): 158. 1903.

<em>Publ</em>.: 1855, p. [i]-vi, [1]-74. <em>Copy</em>: M.

	ischen Eichen</em>, Verh. zool.-bot. Ges. 39 (Abh.): 193-200. Mar-Apr 1889.

Vuyck, Laurens (1862-1931), Dutch botanist and teacher; studied natural sciences at
Leiden University; Dr. phil. ib. 1898 with W.F.R. Suringar; high school teacher at
Leiden, Wageningen and Deventer; ultimately teacher and from 1926-1930 director of
the College for Tropical Agriculture (Koloniale Landbouwschool) at Deventer; active
floristic botanist, from 1889-1911 active in the Nederlandsche Botanische Vereeniging,
later in the Nederlandsche Mycologische Vereeniging. (<em>Vuyck</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: L. – Some <em>letters</em> at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 619; Barnhart 3: 446 (b. 1 Nov 1862, d. 18
Nov 1931); BL 2: 728-729 [index]; BM 5: 2243, 8: 1380; Bossert p.422; CSP 19: 417;
Hirsch p. 313; JW 1: 449, 452, 2: 203, 3: 375; Kelly p. 235; Rehder 1: 302, 391; TL-
1/608; TL-2/3874, 7167; Tucker 1: 726, 3: 324.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Wie is dat? 279-280. 1931.
Jansen, P. &amp; W. H. Wachter, Ned. kruidk. Arch. 41: 449-460. 1932 (obit., portr., bibl.).
Kalkman, C. &amp; P. Smit, eds., Blumea 25(1): 128. 1929 (temporary assignment at Rij-
	ksherbarium 1896-1897; unofficial).
Meulenhoff, J.S., Fungus 3(4): 53-54. 1932 (obit. note).
Sirks, M.J., Vakbl. Biol. 13(4): 57-58. 1931 (obit. not.).
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 1: 407. 1935.
Wachter, W.H., Ned. kruidk. Arch. 55: 68-78. 1947 (on V. and the Ned. bot. Ver.;
	portr.).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Co-editor, with J.W. Moll et al., of C.A.J.A. Oudeman's <em>Enum.
syst. fung.</em> 1919-1924, TL-2/7167.
(2) Editor, J. Kops, <em>Fl. batav.</em> fasc. 21-27, 1901-1930; assisted F.W. van Eeden with some
of the previous fascicles. See TL-2/3874; author indexes vols. 1-25, and vols. 26-27, see
TL-2/2: 650.
(3) A manuscript by Vuyck on Dutch East Indies <em>Begoniaceae</em> was used by S.H. Koor-
ders, in his <em>Excurs</em>.-<em>Fl. Java</em> (TL-2/3866), see 2: 640. 1920 (note 1).
(4) Editor and in part author of W.F.R. Suringar, <em>Zakflora</em> (see TL-2/13.434) eds. 13
(1920) and 14 (1921).
(5) Editor and in part author of <em>Prodromus florae batavae</em>, ed. altera, 1893-1916, see under
R.B. van den Bosch, TL-2/679 (additional dates: 1(3) published Mai 1904).
